author: Stealthy Goat
review: LEGO Star Wars; The Skywalker Saga is one of the best LEGO games I have ever played. I used to play the LEGO games all the time when I was younger, and this game returns the magic of my childhood. For awhile, the LEGO games have felt different. This game however, goes back to the roots while still keeping up to date with new technological possibilities in gaming. There are plenty of characters to play, and more levels than we are used to in most Lego games. The open world aspect is awesome, and any Star Wars fan will enjoy roaming through areas we saw in the films. The game is very visually pleasing too, and runs well in most missions. The only thing I dislike about this game is several performance issues in some levels (specifically the droid factory). I have an RTX 3090 and my game was running 10 frames per second during the droid factory mission. There are also a few missions where my frame rate would drop to 30 frames which is unusual for my computer in most games. Other than that, the game runs perfectly without any issues. I assume the performance issue levels with be addressed and fixed in the upcoming weeks.

author: BLACKTHUNDER
review: As a Lego star wars fan since I was a kid and played the complete saga many many times I am honestly very surprised of how far these games have come. I was very excited for this games release I even pre-ordered though I normally don't pre-order many games but as excited as I was I am still amazed every time I play. There is an abundance Star Wars lore that any fan would surly enjoy which just makes the game feel like the team behind it are fans as well that shows true in every aspect of this game story as well as side missions. The game mechanics just work exactly how you would imagine it would amazing job and has come a very long way since the first games which is honestly hard to do since the saga was a 10/10 game already. I would honestly go as far to say this is the best game to come out in quite a while at least since "covid-19''. I love this game and would recommend it to anyone who has any interest in tar Wars even for someone who is just getting into it. This game has the quirkiness of all the rest of the Lego games and  perfectly balances with the seriousness of  the Star Wars galaxy. GREAT GAME  "11.75/10"  would  recommend

author: Lukas
review: HOW TO MAKE STAR WARS BIRTHDAY CAKE (DEATH STAR CAKE)?Bake chocolate cake– Let it cool completely.Make frosting– Use it to fill and frost your dome cake.Roll out black fondant- Spread it over the cake and cut off excess along the sides.Roll out gray fondant – Cut out a circle piece and add details to it with knife and some small circles and square pieces.Make an indentation- Use the back of a spoon or your fingers to gently dig into the top side of the cake and stick the circle piece here with some water.Roll out gray fondant again– Cut out rectangle pieces.Add details– Use a sharp knife and various sizes of circle decorating tips to create indentations on each rectangle piece.Stick them to the cake- Use a paintbrush and some water to secure them.Steam cake- This dissolves all the powdered sugar residue and secures all the fondant pieces even more securely in place.Spray the cake– Use silver edible spray to create a metallic finish.Add little lights- Roll out tiny balls of red and white fondant and randomly stick them on the cake.Enjoy- You are finally done!

author: ieatglue
review: keep in mind i have only played up to the darth maul mission so this isn't a review for the full game. so far this game is a shallow shell of what made the original lego star wars good. this game had 2 missions maybe 3 before the maul fight and all of them were short and boring even maul himself sucked to fight because it was short and stupidly simple. compared to the original that included only 6 mission per episode that were decent length action packed and full of content to explore through multiple playthroughs. most of my 1 and a half hours were spent walking around a hub world and watching the cool ♥♥♥♥ we got to play through in episode 1 happens in cutscenes. you also get bombarded with a dumb skill tree and more stuff to collect to pad out the missions. there is also no puzzles to do there is nothing so far where i have to use specific characters or where i need to actually do something besides walk forward. all in all i really wanted to like this game and i will give it a second chance when it goes on sale but for now bad game.

author: Chizz
review: Not the full nostalgic feel from the Childhood game but enough to make you enjoy it. For a LEGO game it lacks building. The story lacks some missions from previous games but still is enjoyable to play through and kill time. Challenges are repetitive and similar but are varied enough to keep you playing. Side missions to collect more kyber bricks and characters are enjoyable and give you something else to do if you have finished the story or just want to do something else. If you enjoy casual relaxing games that you want to complete or just want a hit of nostalgia I believe this game will fulfil that. Price wise though I wish it cheaper as it feels like more could of went into the game and made more things to do.

author: B00G3RFAC3
review: Lego Star Wars: the Skywalker Saga is an amazing game for any fans of Lego, Star Wars, or the Lego Star Wars games from the 2000's. It allows player to explore the Galaxy far far away we see in the films and collect hundreds of iconic ships and characters that are all faithfully adapted and fun to play as for hours as you collect more and more across the galaxy. What the Lego star Wars game gets right, it gets VERY right. Unfortunately though, the replay-ability that made the original LSW games still fun to play almost 2 decades later is lost here. Levels can be tedious to run through again and again for missed Minikits and challenges and frustrating when player control is yanked away for gimmicky level design. After entering the Galaxy in FreePlay I haven't found a way to get back and play through the full episodes again which means a New Game had to be created when my friends wanted to play through the full story with me. What was the games strongest aspect on the initial play-through is now it's biggest weakness as I can't see many people coming back to play through a episode for fun once 100% is obtained. Disappointing, especially because in anticipation for this game I played through the Complete Sagas entire story Mode 1-6 because the levels are so much fun.Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga is a good game, Whether this is your first Lego Game or you're a veteran you won't be disappointed with how much there is to see and do in the Lego Galaxy Far Far Away.

author: EPIC_GUY_312
review: I've never been a huge fan of the Starwars movie series but I have played a few games such as Jedi Fallen Order and The force unleashed. Luckily with this game, it gives me the encouragement to watch all 9 movies in order and then go play the Lego version after I finish 1 of the films. Doing this has given me a very fun introduction to the series and I'm loving it so far. Watching the movies, replaying them in their charming polished Lego form, and then spotting out the differences and similarities is very fun. I would highly recommend this to someone who is a Starwars fan, Lego fan, or someone who is completely new to the series that has access to all 9 films.

author: LmFaō (Chinese Hacka)
review: Highly anticipated game is extremely poorly optimized: it runs fine but some levels drop my fps from 100+ to 15-20. (Changing graphic settings, of which there are like 4 or 5, does nothing to solve or even alleviate the problem), Remote play is seriously bugged as I (player 1) lose control of the game as soon as someone connects, unless I'm using the keyboard. This result in not having a player 2 and having player 1 being controlled by both the host's keyboard and guest's controller, rendering the game unplayable for both.The level design is pretty boring with little constructions and puzzles that are now most of the time replaced by a "terminal" minigame (basically a quick-time event or Simon Says).The only fun I had was with some clever jokes and flying in space (which becomes pretty boring too after some time due to the lack of content).The other thing i cannot stand is the unskippable menu animation at startup with Rey saying "I need someone to show me my place in this", which is fine the first 5 times you hear it but becomes really cringy and annoying as time goes on.

author: Qualiti
review: It's a beautiful and Gameplaywise really fun game. Its easy, YES! It's totally kinda too easy for its own good what is a bummer not gonna lie.but i still had a blast and really fun time playing Prequel and Original trilogy, and also not so much in the Sequel's (100% better than the movies tho.)The combat is good and really fun. Especially with a lightsaber character's who have really cool and different styles with multiple combo capabilities. Sadly the boss battles are EZ (Elden Ring ripoffs) and you can't quite use them that much, because the health bar is gone faster than Anakin's turn to the dark side. nonetheless the bosse's are quite fun and creative adaptations from the Movies.The puzzle's are easy and painfully repetitive in some places, and many were already seen in older Lego games so the thing called "New" experience is for those who stopped playing after the characters started talking in these games.The levels are fun, but really fast and over in 5 minutes in most cases. Also to my disappointment some levels were unfortunately skipped, like the final battle between Obi-Wan and Vader in New Hope, also The Battle Over Coruscant in ep3 and the battle between Windu and THE SENATE. and not to mention the Epic Battle inside the second Death Star. Its still playable and totally worth your time and especially if you you’re a True Star Wars-fan and you want to experience the whole movie saga in LEGO.Its definitely that love letter for the new and also old Lego Star Wars fans alike, you should give it a try. :)

author: Zulu
review: Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth Plagueis The Wise? I thought not. It’s not a story the Jedi would tell you. It’s a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise he could use the Force to influence the midichlorians to create life… He had such a knowledge of the dark side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful… the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself.

author: Vanguard
review: Genuinely a great and bad game, if you just want to play the story-line great, knock yourself out, was fantastic and I'd play it 100x over. If you're trying to 100% the game like I am, just give up on life all together. TT Games made it their main priority to make this game absolutely unplayable and broken, challenges, side-quests, puzzles, races all fun, but the amount of things they did bug-check makes me rage harder than 4 year old little german boy who can't play fortnite or drink cola. The Game constantly breaks when it comes to objectives in-game and on the map, displays bug out and there's no getting around it. One of my current quests bugged out and now I cannot complete which I need in order to complete the sector. If you're trying to collect kyber bricks don't bother looking at your map, they most of the time disappear after you collect them, but in some cases they do not and it has you wondering if you have them. Shame on me for getting upset at the slightest mistakes this developing team makes, I would much rather experience Japanese water torture than try and play this bugged out game. I know where the TT games HQ is.

author: adnn
review: I will update this review once I play the game more but for now I think I should tell you how I feel. *TLDR: Get this game its great*I'm currently on Episode IV playing in chronological order, meaning I've done all the prequels and so far I'm having a blast. My biggest complaint at the moment is that Episode IV has too much blaster combat, and blaster combat seems to be slow, I don't know if I'm missing something or not. But it's better to just combine a blaster shot or two with melee combat. The game offers tons of replayability with the freeplay mode and galaxy free roam mode. Freeplay mode is where you can go back to a previous mission but play as any character rather than the set canon characters (for example - Senator Jar Jar Binks fighting Anakin on Mustafar). With the Deluxe edition costing $60 and the main game costing $50, its a steal, as deluxe comes with all dlc characters. With this game boasting 380 characters on its own, over 100 vehicles, and more, you're sure to have a ton of replayability, and the main game itself takes around 24-30 hours to beat. If you're looking for replayability and a fun world to explore, this is it. If you're a star wars fan looking for a good star wars game, this is it. If you're looking for good melee combat and an entertaining story, this is it. If you're looking for a light-hearted story with gameplay that's easy for any casual to pick up and play, this is it. The bossfights are also very fun, If I had to pick my favorite so far it would be the Palpatine boss fight in Episode III. Once I complete Episode IX, I will edit this review. Until then, get this masterpiece. This is peak star wars.

author: Swindle
review: Detailed Review:-Gameplay:Overall, the gameplay is incredibly fun. The amount of things that you cam do is truly endless. Even after completing all nien chapters, there IS STILL a lot of maps to cover over. The gameplay is so well done and the combat battles are very well done!-Content:A big chunk of this game is the infinite amount of exploration for each map. So much to cover in each episode of all three trilogies. Even after beating all nine chapters, there is so much to do. So many side quests, so many little objectives of your own that you can make. And that’s just for each episode of the game. The free roam handles this very well too! When playing the free roam, there are a great many maps to explore with many little easter eggs! The content is endless and you can probably see yourself playing this for MONTHS just to 100% the game.-Voice Acting:The acting is so very well done, although the casting for SOME character are a bit questionable, overall it’s pretty good. A majority of the Clone Wars voice actors managed to reprise their roles in this game which I can appreciate VERY much.-Storyline:The game itself knows when it’s being goofy and when it’s being serious. Well balanced between those two. Overall you can play the game expecting a frw laughs along the way, and just have a good time having a blast with this over the top silly gameplay.-Overall Thoughts:There are a few things that I would change personally about the gameplay, but overall the game is in such an amazing state and I have no regrets buying the game. If you love Star Wars and overall having a blast of a time and just having fun, I HIGHLY suggest this game for you. It’s genuinely amazing how well made this game is and what it stands for.-Personal Rating:9/10

author: Widword
review: The visual gags and funny lines/memes alone make this game amazing and worth it. Constantly abusing the NPC's and slapping the crap out of the AI player 2 can provide hours of fun. Coins are pretty much infinite and easy to come by (if you love breaking every breakable item on the map). It's been awhile since I've been able to put more than 2 hours into a game session before getting bored, but Lego Star Wars keeps me entertained for well over 4 hours.

author: NicNos
review: This game is great but there are some things that it is missing - Character Customization and online multiplayer. You get so invested in exploring every world that I wish I had my own character to add that level of emersion. This game would also be so much better with Dev support. When you play the game for a while you realize that there is so much in the game that the devs could explore when it comes to content. Such as space missions, online co-op missions where you and your friends could explore areas and solve puzzels to get a rare skin or unlock a character. this game could be the GTA online of the lego world ( when it comes to content and where they can take the game with updates and replayability) Thank you for coming to my ted talk

author: DarthGriffin
review: The good:- HUGE. Literally. The only people who are gonna get past 75% completion are completionist nutters. Power to you, you mad people. More characters than you can fit in a Sandcrawler and vast open environments that blend nearly seamlessly with missions- combat is improved. You can either perfectly plan out your combos and make things work..... or just mash the attack keys and it still works.- Did I mention how huge it is? The planets are beautiful. Some have multiple areas, some only one. The graphics are stunning and my PC is from 2016 with only a slight chug during AotC and one single freeze n crash- character classes are neat and add a lot to gameplay. Plus switching between characters is easier than ever. You can select all or quick swap which is handy- Wedge Antillies VA- Lots of Clone Wars VAs are back (Anakin, Obi-Wan, Padme, battle droids, clones)- humor is don't blink or you'll miss the gag in the backgroundthe meh:- collecting all the collectibles gets very repetitive very quickly- Kylo Ren's VA isn't Adam Driverthe bad:- compared to Lego SW Complete, some of the missions are uninspired and some are VERY short. There's also some parts of the movies that are cut scenes rather than playable missions and some opportunities were missed- kinda almost too big- you can button mash during combat and still win- unlike Lego SW Clone Wars, ground vehicles are limited to non-existent - Yellow eyes Anakin- no Jennifer Hale voice acting at all To sum up, you can't kill Porgs, 0/10

author: XxMLGM1N3CR4FTKIDxX
review: This game is great and is pleasant to look at. this game has, so far, proven itself as a successful succesor to The Complete Saga!A solid 8.5!One aspect about the game, however, really gets on my nerves. I truly despise the QTEs in this game. I was born with a disability called Friedrich's Ataxia (FA), which impacts the muscles in the body, causing the legs and arms to not function as they should. The QTE that dislike the most is the key mashes which I cannot physically do.This game should have a solution to this such as enabling/disabling QTEs in the menu.

author: RichardGaming
review: This game is the ultimate culmination of all things Lego Star Wars. The team at Travelers Tales have completely outdone themselves. While there are some pretty jarring frame drops, resolution and rendering issues, they are completely overshadowed by the obvious love and care that went into the creation of this game. There are breathtaking moments that cannot be properly shared in a review, just play the game, I promise, even if you did not play the classic games, you with be blown away. A few gripes of mine involve the lack of difficulty (yes this is mostly marketed to children) and a lot unnecessary repetition in many of the puzzles; however, these are easily overlooked. The vastness of this game and the amount of variation in the story mission completely make up for the few (but apparent) shortcomings of the game. Overall I would say this is one of the most enjoyable games I have played in the last few years and is something I will come back to time and time again. Well done guys <3

author: Sir. Vapenation
review: For those who want a quick rating:7/10This game has been getting a lot of praise,  , and most, if not, all are correct.However here is a (Oppinionized) list of issues.IMPORTANT NOTE:The pro's mostly outweigh the cons listed below. don't take my reveiws or others too suriously. if you want to buy the game, buy it. worst case scenerio you can refund it.the MAJOR complaint:The clone wars epesodes are a GIANT dissapointment, i mean i never felt this mad about LEGO, but now i do. Out of all the missions, their are only 2 missions that have clones. The first then you meet Jenga fett, and the one where the clones betray you. Their is no missions that you play that have you acatualy help fight.missions are annyoing when they are not combat.You have to walk to a point, watch a cutscene, then walk to another point. it begins to feel redundentThe combat isnt really satisfying. Hold block and spam the melee button to win most battles. Sure you have a duel here and there but just kinda boring.They were also lazy about dialogue as their is no lip-syncing, just random mouth movements that imitate talking. This is more a feature i dont care much about though.Can't change graphics in-game as far is i seen, meaning you have to play the game, go to main menu, loosing progress in the mission, just to make sure you can make the game run better.Default keybinds kinda suck. For example, Left click is to throw the lightsaber, while Q (or E, whichever) was to melee. I think this is present in most LEGO games however.Shooting guns is essentialy aimbot, where as long as your in the general direction of their hitbox, your laser hits it.I feel the epesodes are short, compared to the older lego starwars. I'm unsure if their is chapter-epesodes or just chapters where you do everything. if its the first thing, than ignore this one.Way too much loading screens.You can't skip the intro to main menu screen, and fast travel takes up 30 seconds at most, but you will be using it a lot, while loading planets take a long time.Upgrade/skill point system sucks. it requires you to stop playing missions to explore a world to gain these. for the most part, these upgrades are useless however.No difficulty change as far as i can tell, meaning i'm locked to fighting against lasers that do miniscule damage.Not much directions in missions other than "Go here" or "Defeat this person". For example the droid factory, it took me 5 minutes to figure out i was supposed to destory a floating container, and the only hint to it was sparkles.too much walking, as far as i know, you must arive at a plannet, then go to the fast travel system to go to diffrent parts of the plannet.Tab menu is really cluttered, i still cant grasp what to do, because their is so many things, perhaps too many.Options (Menu, not in-game) are somewhat limited.Missing a bit of qaulity of life stuff. for example, you are told to purchase the running skill, yet their is no way to turn off automatic running, which sometimes leads you to being either too fast or too slow when following a person for a mission.Boss fights are hardly boss fights.Honestly i was quite dissapointed. Like i said earlier about bosses, you can mostly just spam the melee button, and given you avoid their attacks its a easy win. because their is no difficulty changer (as far as i know) i'm given too much time before the boss strikes to notice and move away from the AOE indicator, often having my fights taking little to no damage.

author: 󠀡󠀡󠀡󠀡󠀡󠀡//TB
review: The good- Packed to the point of bursting with references, quotes and memes from within the SW universe- Similar in feel to the original games with updates to the formula to keep things fresh- Great graphics and details for both environments and the bricks - Expansive "open world" hubs to explore (think Tomb Raider-ish) - Genuinely well written slapstick comedy and gagsThe bad - Episode levels themselves are much shorter than the older games, the bulk of the gameplay is spent in the hubs- Voicelines of characters start to repeat very quickly- Mumble mode is much an afterthought and doesn't sync well with cutscenes - Some menu and minigame screens navigation feels very clunky- Only has splitscreen co-op, no online playThe neutral- Very casual gameplay, up to you to decide whether this is a pro or a con, the game isn't difficult for obvious reasons and you can't do too much to remedy it if you wanted to- Amount of content can be overwhelming at the start of the game- The open world hubs are mainly reliant on a kyber brick collectathon interspersed with fetch quests and races of different varieties- No Clone Wars content (somewhat understandable but not even characters are included)- PC performance is acceptable but graphics options are somewhat lackingI would happily recommend 66% of this game to fans of the original Lego titles and the franchise in general

author: 2fast4dad
review: This is one of if not the best lego game. After playing every single one (not all to completion) I can safely say even before finishing the entire game that this is the best. They have improved on everything that the other lego games tried to do. An incredibly interesting open world and way less focus on stretching out missions as long as possible. With recent titles I've gotten bored completing missions because they are so tedious. However, the missions in this game are short and to the point, sometimes even too short. (but that isn't a bad thing)Combat isn't amazing by any means but it's actually interesting and you need to pay some attention. While most upgrades don't really do anything for combat it's amazing that you can actually upgrade character abilities. Despite that it isn't perfect it is still by far the best combat in any lego game. The story is the star wars movies so I can't say much bad about that. I won't even lie either some of the cutscenes even made me laugh; for humor directed at kids I'm glad I can still laugh at it. One minor annoyance and I assume this has to do with licensing issues but man do I hate the new voice actors. I'm not sure why they weren't able to get the rights to at least most of the actors dialogue or maybe this was just a creative choice, no idea. I seriously can't praise them enough for how amazing this game is. Lego games have become so boring to me and this was such a refreshing entry into the lineup. Thank you TT for really putting a ton of effort into making a great game, it really shows.

author: Mr Goodman
review: I grew up playing Lego star wars the complete saga so was hyped to finally play this, especially after waiting over 3 years for it to release. This game did not disappoint, with amazing graphics, great story and game-play and the witty comedy u can expect from lego games which brought a smile to my face multiple times throughout playing. Its hard to find anything to fault with this game, maybe just some long levels that are based on scenes that got very few minutes airtime in the films have slightly tedious and long missions in this game (Droid factory on geonosis, search for Luke on hoth etc.) Overall, would definitely recommend to any fans of star wars or lego.

author: Blood Eagle
review: What a wonderful gameSo much to explore, so much you cant explore unless you come back and replay it with other characters, leaving excitement. So many upgrades from the priveous lego star wars games. Oh and graphics are awesome!!The combat system is over the roof honestly! Combos, mid air force attacks, swinging till your enemy is nothing but pork.On and the space side of this game is.. perfectico. The ships are so SO well designed, ships wings change formation when boosting, the gunshots sounding so satisfying, and again.. the graphips are so beautiful in space, it doesn't feel like a lego game AT ALL. Take your focus away from all the lego bricks and studs, and it wont feel like a lego game at all. It looks so realistic!!!Anyway, the way they tell the story is pretty good! But could be better. There are some glitches in the game, tho the day of writing this, its only been a few days since launch. The major bugs like game crashing will be gone in no time. Ive only had the game crash on me once.Overall this game is 1000% worth getting!! For yourself and your friends! Tho there is no online mode.. only local multiplayer.. you know, classic lego games.But any bad new you here about this game are mostly overrated or on the way to be fixed, since after day one, there was a 2.5 mb update and havent seen any major bugs since.

author: Stealitnot
review: Edit: While it was incredibly buggy before, it has now gotten to the point of unplayability. Missions soft lock, players randomly get thrown in a death loop, things get checked or unchecked randomly, geometry just disappears, textures will flicker or disappear or swap for some reason, dialogue will not play or loop forever, innocent accidental sequence breaking can make a mission uncompleteable, swapping characters at the wrong time can just crash the game or break a mission, upgrades will just stop working, guns can spawn with no ammo or you'll be unable to drop them or both, doing another space side mission while doing a story mission in space marks it imcomplete forever even if you got the rewards, doing any space side mission will spawn all captured ships with very low textures and no collision but you won't be able to see anything since they're so big, falling out-of-world is constant, unlocked characters will sometimes just be unpurchasable,... At one point I was in Otoh Gunga and the game just randomly started spawning millions of fish that swam through everything and crashed my whole PC. The list goes on and on. What I'm saying is that it is a fun LEGO game, but also one of the buggiest games I've ever played. You can be a Droideka and fly a giant GNK, but I really hope they fix it for anyone who wants to play it in the future.

author: Grass
review: I waited 3 years for this game. I don't think it was worth it, but by god did they impress me. This is far and beyond both the best looking and best feeling lego game EVER.Let's say that's not your jam... that's fine, because Lego Star Wars the Skywalker saga will still probably have something for you. They have an upgrade system, and its pretty deep too! You can use "Kyber crystals" (an important currency) and studs (also important currency) to buy upgrades. Anyways, fantastic game and I'm very excited to see what they can do with this kind of blueprint to follow.TLDR; Took their time on a very very good game, 9/10 (+3 for nostalgia, it strums the heartsrings)

author: ald234
review: Was afraid it wasn't gonna live up to my childhood of playing The Complete Saga but I have to admit that this is a extremely solid game through and through, sure the levels are a bit short but I feel like that is because the game is relying on you to roam the open world segments and collect the things.After the countless delays I was starting to get a tad worried, sure its missing some features such as custom characters (which maybe they can patch in sometime in the future) but overall this is a very solid LEGO game and I cannot wait to see what TT Games does next with the LEGO game series.If you're a fan of LEGO games or if you're just a fan of Star Wars in general I highly recommend playing this one, so many great easter eggs/funny moments and lots of fanservice to be had for fans of Star Wars.

author: slayercorpse
review: I might edit my review when I finish the game but so far it's pretty good. The only problem I've had is during the segments where it incorporates 2 different groups of people. In the level "Droid Factory Frenzy", the game SEVERELY dropped frames throughout the whole level. Only during the cut scenes was it smooth. I have decent specs and was able to run the game at a solid 120 FPS with high settings, but even with turning all the fancy graphics off, and all settings on low, it still dropped frames insanely during this specific segment. It was somewhat playable but it ruined the whole experience of the level for me. I hope these sections don't lag like this again when they come up. Can people try to let me know if they have the same issue? other then that I'm looking forward to playing the rest of the game. Just hope that gets fixed so I can experience it like normal.

author: Ripliner
review: This is a difficult rate.  Ive played through episode 1 and 2, and am now mid way in episode 3.  If youve been looking for a starwars game, this will do.  However, it is a bad lego game.  When i think back to the last three starwars lego games, the complete saga, the trilogy, and starwars 3, the first thing i notice is the lack of puzzles.  Puzzles in lego games were a staple of the franchise, little things that always kept you thinking, but they are almost non existant in this game.  Thats not to say that the skywalker saga is a bad game, its good, but if you go into it with the expetation of the last three, and their story style, you will be dissapointed.  Another thing ive noticed that is super off putting is how much time they put into the story of starwars.  The key moments are there, but they are short.  If i wasnt super well versed in the lore of the franchise id be supper confused constantly with how quick they want to move the story along.  Key moments are cut short, and i feel if they had just extended the cutscenes to be a little longer, just by maybe 10 seconds, the weight of the story could have been more expressed.  But onto the good.  The game is openworld-ish.  There are tons of places that you can walk around in, like the open segments of new games, except on every major planet and area within the story of starwars.  The characters sound amazing, near identical to their film and cartoon counterparts.  Little bits of dialogue while youre escorting people are a nice touch too, and i think thats one of the main complaints people have, the escorting.  And i think the reason people have that problem is because every lego starwars game before this, the cutscene took out the middle part of walking to and fro, however this is, for better or worse, open world, so you actually have to go between areas.  YOU actually have to hop in a ship and pick which planet to go to, you have to navagate between the different levels of corosaunt.  And if you go into this thinking itll just hurry you along, youll probably be caught off guard.  I will update this when i get deeper into/finish the game, but as of right now, this game is a yes from me.  Sure it has its problems, and sure some things are lacking.  But its lego starwars, and if youre a fan of the franchise, youll like it.

author: Me :)
review: This game feels like it was made with this priority:1. Collectables2. Everything else3. Level design and storyIt's such a shame, the open world is so vast and beautiful - but everything in this game just feels like it's a vehicle for the abundance of collectables. This isn't a bad thing when implemented well with actual gameplay that the player enjoys, but I just don't. Every single mission can be cleared in under 10 minutes, then you're in the open world for until the next one. You spend more time in the open world then in the missions themselves. The mission designs are boring and repetitive, small boss fights lasting 5 minutes at best or a space battle. There's no memorable missions thus far in the game and it's a real shame as that was what made collectables so alluring in the original LEGO Star Wars games. It was because the missions were so fun and jam-packed with things to do that I wanted to go back and get them. But now, the game consists of really short boring missions followed by a terrible cutscene that tries desperately to tell 30mins worth of story in 2 minutes and then you're back in the open world.This is not everything either, the menus feel so clunky, really bad pacing (even for a LEGO game) and the bugs I've encountered - while few and far between, have been game breaking, one made it so I can't progress through the story at all by locking off the next mission start icon Maybe I've just become too jaded and my expectations were too high since I last played a LEGO game (Star Wars III Clone Wars) but I was really underwhelmed by the lack of fun and meaningful gameplay. This is by no means saying this game is bad, but for me, after being delayed 2 years. It was underwhelming.

author: [YJL] ZondaFreak
review: Not linear at all to the degree of previous LEGO titles, The Skywalker Saga provides the ultimate exploratory and open world experience. With 45 levels and 380 characters, it is properly vast; however (so far) it contains less building or forced puzzle solving than usual. This isn't good or bad, just different. Enjoy smiles aplenty with the traditional humorous plot reenactments during cutscenes. A great kid-friendly game. 9/10

I think, had I not explored, I'd have maybe finished ep1 in an hour to an hour and a half? The game's fun. It's got a lot of good, added humour. If you like Star Wars, you'll probably enjoy this.

I'm hopeful most of these issues will be sorted soon enough, but, this game thus far has given me a lot of troubles such as not saving the refresh rate and resolution of my monitor when tabbed out and back in, borderless windowed, more often than not, will still show the taskbar and the game will be an incorrect resolution, some levels such as the droid factory has abysmal performance with sub 20 fps where other sections i will get 150+ fps.

And the sound track is straight flame put drake on the track and you've got a banger hands down, gaining #1 worldwide charts and going plat in the first week. There's a lot to collect and little side objectives to do. I do have some negatives about the game though. During one part whenever I tried to switch my character the camera froze and I needed to return to the main menu and start up the game again to resume playing. Then there were two different times my screen just turned black, I needed to X out the game and start it again. Other than that everything seems very well done I just hope that's fixed soon.

author: Chiakuu
review: Now that the release excitement has worn off, Lego Star Wars The Skywalker Saga (TSS) is a very visually impressive game, but falls short of the originals in my opinion. I have heard that it is more of an open world pretending to be a episodic game, and I agree - especially on Kashyyyk. It is very much an open world with an occasional objective, rather than a dedicated level like The Complete Saga (TCS) has. The open world is nice, and has challenges to discover and solve, but the challenges range from the brick being behind some junk on the ground to the Yavin IV puzzle board that if you have discovered it you know what I am talking about. Still haven't solved it. The Open World also feels very small at times when you discover red barriers and/or are just unable to walk any farther. At least finally a game lets you explore Coruscant, even if you don't get to see much. Also the podracing level is awful in TSS and made me feel sick.One big thing missing from The Skywalker Saga that I sorely miss is the Bounty Hunter missions from earlier games, specifically TCS. In TCS there is a short and sweet mode where you and a group of bounty hunters have a target to find in a short time period. It is an incredibly simple mode, but the premise I love - playing as a group of bounty hunters hired with a mission to complete. TCS is better in that regard than The Clone Wars III (TCW) because instead of being a group like in TCS you have to switch between them in TCW. In TSS there is neither of those - the closest is a search for Bossk. A thing that I thought was clever in TCS's Bounty Hunter mode was also that the droids with you (eg IE-88) could hack droid panels as they are bounty hunter droids - that makes sense. In The Skywalker Saga they do not have that ability at all, nor does anyone else.I love the idea of bounty hunter missions - which Star Wars Battlefront 2015 had a version of - but in TSS it is missing entirely. It makes me so sad to see such an amazing idea left behind.The controls in TSS arent as bad as Lego Star Wars The Force Awakens (TFA) - they are less distracting and awful than TFA was compared to the original games, but to be honest I still prefer the simplicity of the original games. In TCS it was simple controls that you could just relax and play - in The Skywalker Saga it seems overly complicated in some aspects and just doesn't feel as clean and simple as TCS. Even if the controls can be overly complicated, the game is still missing out on the small details on characters. For instance, the original games just felt like they had more uniqueness between characters - almost every character in a class in TSS has the exact same abilities, no matter what. They just feel less unique to me, even though there is more options for characters to differ. Going back to the bounty hunter missions, I thought it was incredibly clever and sleek that the droid bounty hunters could hack the panels! But in TSS there is really no special things between characters - they may do different attacks when you spam a button compared to other characters in their class, but at the end of the day that isn't something you'd see in regular combat unless you specifically go looking for it. Those special attacks - for instance Boba Fett will use either a flamethrower or a grapple after you attack and then spam B - aren't even needed in regular combat. 9 times out of 10 you can just shoot and dodge and win combat, or just punch the enemy and occasionally switch buttons when they block. Those different combat abilities also are not helped by the awful voice acting in a lot of instances - I'm sorry, but adult Boba's voice just grates on my ears. The space combat is also sorely disappointing, especially based on the trailer. Episode III's Chapter 1 (Battle over Coruscant) from TCS is completely missing in TSS - that was such a cool space battle, even if it was on rails, but its just a cutscene in TSS. The general space combat in TSS is just disappointing - it is more in-depth than older lego games, but at the same time space seems completely empty. For instance, you can jump to a planet and join dogfights that are happening overhead - thats all you'll ever see in combat. There is no capital ships in orbit when you arrive, there is nothing interesting besides a tug of war you can join. Even Bigg's space mission is sad - you have to escort cargo to Yavin IV while getting attacked on the way, but when you're attacked its just by short range TIE fighters that should not have been able to stop you without a carrier. You defeat the fighters like 5 times with them increasing in number, and that is it. Even when you arrive at Yavin IV you just defeat more fighters and you're done. There is nothing to see in space, no interesting battles to fight, nothing. The only time you really see capitol ships in space is in Episodes like in Empire Strikes Back when escaping from Hoth, but thats for 30 seconds. The comedy in TSS is also way weaker than TCS - its visual comedy is still funny, but it is just no-where near the gold that the original was. For example, Darth Vader no longer holds up a family photo to convey that he is Luke's father - its just mumbles that you understand from seeing the movie. It has its moments, even if the voice acting drags it down, but it still doesn't stand up. One other thing they changed that I find incredibly sad is Episode III Anakin Vs Obi-Wan. In TCS Obi (P1) and Anakin (P2) had to escape from the facility collapsing the entire time until they reached the final island, and then it was P1 vs P2. Throughout Episode II and III you and P2 had been through everything together, and at the final end it was Sibling vs Sibling, player vs player. To me that was perfect, very creative, and perfectly invoked the feeling of brother vs brother in Anakin VS Obi-Wan. In TSS it is just a standard boss battle with P2 being the droids, and thats it.To sum it up, The Skywalker Saga is a visually impressive game that falls short of the originals. Its visually impressive, technically impressive if overly busy-feeling, but its comedy, storytelling, levels, space combat, voice acting, and lack of a bounty hunter missions mode hold it back greatly. The open world has plenty of stuff to explore, but there isn't much to see besides kyber crystals to collect. You can explore Coruscant finally, but its the small movie-slices that you would expect. The characters do not feel unique for the most part, which is very disappointing. However, the big thing that brings down TSS to me is the lack of the bounty hunter missions - I really did think those were so much fun and so unique in TCS.  It may seem small to you, but it's just something that i really enjoy in Star Wars games and really brought TCS up even farther than it already was.Also they removed LEGO Yoda death scream, that is a crime.

author: CallMeKP123
review: To say I was excitement leading up to the release of this game would be a HUGE understatement as I am 21 years old so a major part of my childhood was the older LEGO Star Wars titles. This game has brought me back to my childhood as well as taking the old games and taking everything to new heights! This game does have a few bugs and optimisation issues (I have a 3900X and RTX 3080 and was getting like 20-40fps in the Geonosis factory mission), but that doesn't mean they can't roll out a couple of updates to fix these issues. I am reliving my childhood here and I can't lie, after completing episodes 1, 2, 3 and 4, it is a masterpiece so far for me. Also the main missions aren't where it ends. The game is fully open world and you can explore and complete side missions on each and every single planet and there is a s**t ton to do! I see myself putting many hours in to this absolute gem!

author: Branch Off Bush
review: I have only gone through the prequel so far, but this is an amazing lego game. It's a revitalization from the original lego formula but that classic lego experience is not missing. My friend who got this game too who saw nothing on this game before buying it, just knew it was a lego star wars game with all 9 movies. When he was in the middle of starting episode 4 for the first mission he said, "oh this is a game game not just a lego game."Level design is amazing, optimization has been good (but I am on a monster rig of an 11th gen i7 and a 3080ti), graphics are amazing. Only had one problem with optimization in the geonosis droid factory. I had 4 playable characters in separate parts of the level and it was hardcore dropping performance. Like 100 fps down to 30 or less. After the characters got closer to each other in the level this improved. The only other gripe I have about this game is how some cutscenes seem very choppy. But that's not really an issue. Id rather have some cutscenes choppy sometimes than an incomplete or broken game. I have had 1 total crashes so far in 15 levels. The open world aspect of this game is also very well designed. If you love old lego games from tt games this one will be very enjoyable and fresh. With a crash course like story for each episode of star wars. Some have been saying there should of been a harder difficulty for people in this game and I think some forgot the key audience of a lego games being kids. Due to this the game's puzzles and battles are fairly straight forward and battles specifically a lot easier if you have played video games for a long time. Don't expect a dark souls level of depth in lightsaber combat. Its a lego game.

author: ᛟLilTraumatikᛟ
review: WARNING! THIS GAME HAS A SEVERE, SAVEGAME CORRUPTING BUG. I lost several hours of progress and several episodes worth to a single Crash-To-Desktop error. Therefore I cannot recommend this game until this issue is fixed.As someone who grew up on the PS2 classics such as the first and second LEGO Star Wars, and other LEGO games of that era, it's amazing to see the direction they've taken it in.I am not a paid reviewer and I'm generally cynical of AAA titles these days, usually SJW pandering ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, and I can't lie, this is the first game I've ever pre-ordered. It delivers on expectations, and exceeds them.This is a must buy for LEGO fans, Star Wars fans and everyone in between.Many new features you didn't think a LEGO game would be able to pull off, but does and well.Runs surprisingly well on a decent but older now PC, shocked at how well a 2018 computer can run a 2022 game.Graphics are nothing short of gorgeous, honestly. Eye candy to the max.Few bugs and glitches, but for a day one/day two release it's held up amazingly well.The humour is on point, definitely captures that old LEGO slapstick style of the older games, and the dialogue adds to it, it doesn't detract. Mumble mode is literally just that, replaces voices with subtitled mumbles. It isn't redone in any way so you're better off with the voices for context and emotion.Side quests and open explorable environments in my LEGO game? It's more likely than you think!Main story missions are a fun, if a little brief reimagining of the older games, you won't be playing the same old levels from TCS, but entirely new sections (with a lot that harkens back to the old levels)It's day two as of review writing, I started playing at like 10AM this morning, it's now 6PM and I'm already half way through the fourth episode, the bulk of the longevity of this game will come from the side missions, exploration and collection, however the campaign is thoroughly enjoyable and would hold up as a standalone game in it's own right.TL;DR: it's everything you ♥♥♥♥♥♥' expected and a hell of a lot more. GTFIH and buy it. You'll thank me later frens.

author: raul_stefan1996
review: Skywalker Saga is a beautiful game. It is breathtaking. The fight combat is awesome and the world is huuuuge. It's the free world roaming Star Wars game we wanted.The episodes' stories seem a little rushed if you ask me but It's ok. I mean they included some parts which weren't in the Complete saga (which to be honest, will remain my favorite Lego game ever, Skywalker saga comes second, I think I can blame the nostalgia for this xD). To be honest, I would have waited for another year if they would have not neglected the story missions. I mean, I can see they put their priorities in the open world which is beautiful but it's a little bit disappointing that the episodes were made in a rush. I know they did a lot of overtime in making the game and I respect the developers. Just saying that they could have made a better job on story missions. Story missions from Episodes 4, 5 and 6 are the most well done in my opinion.The game lacks in replaybility. What I mean by that ? If you want to replay an episode, you can replay just the five levels you can select from. You can't replay the first cutscene of the episode or the first part prior to the first story mission or the little parts between the story levels. Such a bummer. Hoping we will get a chance to replay the episodes at their fullest in a future update.I haven't encountered game-breaking bugs like most of the users, only minor bugs which I'm sure the developers will patch soon.Thank you, TT, for this cool game !May the Force be with you ! Always !

author: MarioDragon
review: The gameplay of this gameis walk > cutscene > walk > cutscene > walk > cutscene. There's not a lot of puzzle variety, all bosses are the same fight, and the UI is extremely cluttered. After all this time I was hoping for a somewhat modernized LEGO game but it's still a step back from previous titles and isn't any better than the original LEGO Star Wars. But since it's not $60, and it's LEGO, and it's got a decent length, and it's still boat loads of fun, and it's relatively glitch free, it's hard to care too much about its problems. The cutscenes are hilarious and you still get a lot of game for the money. If you bought Battlefield 2042, you probably wish you bought this one instead

I blasted this game for 5 hours straight and I'm almost done with Episode 3. I've been having SO much fun and man.. this really is such an awesome game. author: Toran Blackwater
review: EVERTHING IS AWESOME!LEGO® Star Wars™: The Skywalker Saga brought the LEGO franchise game to a new level. Graphics, textures, animation, level design, eye for details (like a micro star destroyer as holo projection), the epic John Williams score and well chosen voice actors. While the old formular (collect studs, revisit some areas after unlocking some characters with new skills) is still the same, presentation and gameplay went up some steps. Controls are very responsive too, while I recommend playing with controller.Best new feature is the free (very smooth) 3rd person camera which allows for better orientation and finally look around in the beautifully crafted levels. Jump sections are easier too with it. This game caters both, LEGO game aswell as Star Wars fans (I think they have about every character of the 9 episodes in this title). Old farts like me start with Episode IV - A New Hope, of course :PPerformance is great, maxed out settings in 2k resolution run with stable 60 FPS on my system:i7-8700K, 32 GB, RTX 2070 Super, Soundblaster Z, installed on a Samsung 870 EVO SSD

author: sambo
review: Did you ever hear the Tragedy of Darth Plagueis the wise? I thought not. It's not a story the Jedi would tell you. It's a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise he could use the Force to influence the midichlorians to create life... He had such a knowledge of the dark side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful... the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. It's ironic he could save others from death, but not himself.

author: Cruisix
review: LEGO and Star Wars. Where to begin. Perhaps a long time ago.It was early 1983 when my father brought home one of those BETAmax movie players and Episode IV: A New Hope. I was 7 years old at the time and watched the movie over and over again in awe.At that time I was a Playmobil child with a little LEGO on the side. Passing the years LEGO became my hobby and many sets came and went. LEGO and Star Wars became a thing and in 2005 I bought LEGO Star Wars: The Video Game. MAN I was blown away by it. So much fun. Later on we had the Complete Saga of the LEGO video game and now in 2022 we have the entire Skywalker Saga in a LEGO game and let me tell you. It's friggin awesome.If you are a lifelong fan of LEGO and Star Wars this is it. Look nog further.The graphics, the detail, the sound, the ambiance. It's all there. It's still the classic LEGO game (collecting stuff!) but in a smooth well optimized package.So again: If you are a lifelong fan of LEGO and Star Wars this is it. Look nog further. BUY IT and enjoy!

author: Ginger Jesus
review: Lego Star Wars has changed the way I think about life, before purchasing this game I was a hard-core racist, I never found myself going outside to see grass, I had never felt the warm embrace of a woman, after purchasing this life-changing game, it made me think deeply. This game has revolutionized my thoughts, I am no longer a raging racist. I attribute this to the character Jar-Jar. The character Jar-Jar is an open-minded loveable character, Jar-Jar's character provokes so much emotion, during my 3rd speedrun attempt, I broke into tears, seeing such a small creature have a massive impact on the game like that, makes me so happy, it shows that the little man still has a shot at making it big. It shows that no matter who you are you can do anything you put your mind to. Jar-Jar has inspired me in so many ways, sometimes at night, I will sit at my desk, staring at pictures of Jar-Jar he gives me inspiration he gives me the willpower to do what I want to do. Jar-Jar has been there for me when no one else was. When I first purchased this game, I hated the thought of touching the grass, I hated the thought of an outside world. This game has shown me that there is more to life than just games, there is a whole new life outside. Although since buying this game I have been diagnosed with Insomnia, Bi-Polar Depression 2, Schizophrenia, as well as a host of physical illnesses, like partial paralysis in my lower body. Aside from that, my mind has never felt better, I feel mentally aware and feel as if I am ready to take on the world. Sometimes at night, I think about how I can achieve greatness and how I can leave my mark on this world, and that is by playing this game that is by finishing this amazing game. As one of my good friends once said "The worst part of having a mental illness is people expect you to behave as if you don't.", This game showed me that I don't have to suppress my thoughts I don't have to act like a normal person I can be who I am. This game has changed my life for the better, I still hope one day I will be able to feel the warm embrace of a woman.

author: Eridium
review: This falls into a category of must-buy. If you enjoy LEGO games, or Star Wars, let alone both, this is a fantastic game. If this is the kind of review where you want a once sentence verdict, here it is; buy the game. It is work the money. Within the first hour, the game will have you hooked and ready to play it for hours and hours. It is by far the most ambitious LEGO game ever released, and it does it all. It is filled to the brim with secrets, puzzles, and free roam exploring. I think honestly, if you only play one LEGO game, it should be this one. IMO, it is the best LEGO game. Props to TT Games and WB Studios for delivering on all the hype, and so much more.

author: BurntBacon
review: Amazing game but can't recommend it in its current state. The game's received no updates to fix the number of game breaking bugs, softlocks, and areas with terrible framerate. I get better fps playing red dead 2 on max settings than I do in the ewok village.Consoles have gotten multiple updates to fix their issues but TT has been in complete silence when it comes to the PC version. The entire situation seems like the PC version of the game was an afterthought, with the issues, lack of updates, terrible keyboard controls. Hell, they never even put in the effort to put trailers on the store page, they threw up a handful of images and called it a day.If TT decides to start caring about this version of the game and fix its issues I'll gladly rebuy it and update my review. But until then it's gonna be a no from me.

author: ֍Fabimann֎
review: Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth Plagueis The Wise? I thought not. It’s not a story the Jedi would tell you. It’s a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise he could use the Force to influence the midichlorians to create life… He had such a knowledge of the dark side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful… the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself.

author: Titanite Chunk
review: If you are expecting the complete saga, but with better combat, you will have what you want in this game. Just be aware of the fact that the game is now 60% open world, the minikit scavenging of the complete saga has been replaced with hunting for the equivalent currency in the open world, with levels being short and concise, usually revolving around a more unique mechanic.

author: Nickumtoo
review: It is truly amazing what TT Games have managed to create here. All the delays, the doubt, the worry... and it's incredible. The game comes out with extremely fair price points and dlc, and it just... it's Lego Star Wars. The magic is there, the humor is on point, and most importantly the absolute LOVE for Star Wars is just so visible, and it's amazing. I just want to say thank you to everyone who made this possible, your time and efforts have truly made something timeless. I think I speak for everyone when I say that this is a very fun ride and well worth your money, if you like Lego games, this is for you. If you like any aspect of SW, this is for you, if you just want a great time with a friend and hours to spend however you wish in a galaxy far, far away, this is the game for you.

author: DuFFy
review: Before I get too negative I do want to list off some positives with this game. Something that is a clear upgrade from the previous Lego Star Wars games is the visuals. The game is downright gorgeous to look at and there were many moments where I paused just to marvel at how good it looked. The animations of the characters are fluid and expressive and the lighting in particular is simply fantastic. A few levels here and there were quite enjoyable such as "Reap What You Solo" and "Boarding Party".HOWEVER…This game is filled with a plethora of issues and I’m going to go through the ones that are the most damaging to its quality.It’s been made pretty clear by multiple sources that this game’s development was a nightmare. The team were pushed to meet a deadline and this resulted in the game feeling incredibly rushed and nowhere is that more apparent than in just how buggy this game can be. During my time playing Story Mode, there were frequent issues regarding enemy spawns, enemies simply not dying and forcing me to reload, cutscene and in-game frame rate stuttering and straight-up crashes. Every game is going to have a few blemishes here and there but this is frankly unacceptable. When the game is crashing or forcing you to replay the entire level this frequently it is a huge problem and I am of the firm belief that the game shouldn’t have been released in this state.Another issue I have with the game is that some of the voices they chose for select characters are pretty awful and don’t sound like their film counterparts. Qui-Gon Jinn, Kylo Ren, Padme and Anakin are all strong offenders here. I understand that Mumble Mode is an option but it’s clear the cutscenes were designed with it off, not to mention the fact the default setting has voices on. Not huge but definitely something worth mentioning.The music of all things is another thing that I feel would benefit from a tweak. As expected it is taken straight from the film OSTs as it was with the previous games but the problem lies in how it was applied. Many scenes are played with ill-fitting music, the best example that comes to mind is Vader’s death theme being played in the middle of Return of the Jedi but not in the actual scene itself. The music also has a tendency to bug out and simply not play at all which leaves some scenes feeling incredibly jarring.I think the biggest issue with this game is the gameplay itself. The Skywalker Saga deviates from the way the previous games were constructed in favour of a sort of hybrid between open world and individual levels. The number of levels has also been decreased to 5 which may seem like a minor change but it not only means parts of the films many people would want to play such as blowing up the Second Death Star are relegated to a cutscene but it also leaves everything in between the levels as mundane, repetitive walking between locations. These sections have a very strict formula:travel to location > interact with whatever it was you came to do > get told to go to next place > travel there > start the main missionThis will of course vary between levels but it is undeniable that there is a LOT of busy work running from location to location that could’ve easily been trimmed down to smooth out the game’s pacing. If I were to get cynical for a second I would say the levels were constructed this way so people would spend more time with the game and thus feel more satisfied with their purchase. Think of it like this, in Revenge of the Sith the game gives you the enthralling gameplay of playing as Padme through every single step of going from her apartment to Mustafar but you don’t get to blow up the Second Death Star. Such a bloody shame.Another aspect of the gameplay I’m not a fan of is the boss battles. For the most part, the lightsaber combat has been greatly improved, instead of blindly spamming the attack button the devs chose to implement a combo system. However, the fights themselves are a joke. Due to the main stories being shortened down you will be doing these one after another quite a lot which obviously gets very repetitious. There’s potential for something here but like many other aspects it feels like more time would have been to its benefit.As the game is now, it is incredibly hollow and unfinished. If the dev team were given another year or so this could’ve been something special. The blueprint for a solid experience here but it simply needed some more time in the oven.I have only played through the Main Story and a few hours of Free Play, that is the accepted caveat here but I was seriously unimpressed. There will undoubtedly be people who had fun and I wouldn’t take that away from anyone but I cannot for the life of me understand how someone could go through the Main Story and not get bored. By the time I finished The Rise of Skywalker I was completely done with the game and I don’t see myself picking it up to try out the rest of Free Play anytime soon. Overall, this game is an empty, repetitive, unfinished experience that I can’t in good conscience recommend you pick up. If you want a fun, well designed Lego Star Wars Game, just pick up The Complete Saga.

author: ThePiachu
review: As a veteran LEGO player, this game is a mixed bag.The game focuses a lot more on open world exploration, giving you a lot more activities to do between missions. This means a lot of situations that would've been mission levels now aren't and instead you get to follow slow NPCs moving from point A to B as they spout lines from the movies. Heck, some things to do between missions is literally "go from A to B, then from B to A, listening to dialogue".Oh yeah, if you haven't played any LEGO game since the old Star Wars games - they use dialogue from the movies now. It robs the games of their pantomime charm and instead all the situations are mostly played straight with an occasional character being goofy to the side. If you know your Star Wars, you will be bored with this sooner than later.A lot of the levels feel more clunky than they have the right to. The Bigger Fish mission controls awfully, podracing is very much on rails and first person (it feels awful!), space sections overwhelm you with 100 markers for things to destroy, etc.The game does look very visually appealing for the most part. Everything is shiny plastic and well modelled. What's a bit jarring is when you notice some models have baked-in grime on top of it and it doesn't look that good.So yeah, the game is a mixed bag. Definitely has a lot of content and will keep you busy for hours, but it doesn't feel more fun to play than the original two Lego Star Wars games, which is unfortunate.

author: Niggo
review: Story:I'm not very far into the story yet (fifth mission or so). At this point the game is just boring. The main story missions usually are the most important to me and the game definitely does not deliver on those. They are short in content, even if you destroy and explore much.The story also is hard to follow, because many parts of the movie are not compressed but rather just cut entirely.The tone is also off.Even for a lego game it is too light hearted, which destroys many of the good moments and even the little bit of thrill it still had.In comparison to the complete saga, the tone is the biggest take away for me.The humor again is dumped down. Better than latest lego games, but still worse than the complete saga.The voice acting is surprisingly good. Thought I had to play in mumble mod, but I changed my mind. It is not just a movie line rip off (or they are that good at hiding it).Mechanics:Many of the "new" mechanics, like choosing a path (stealth or rushing in e.g.) or interacting with a console are not that great.Choosing a path usually is very dissatisfying, because I always feel like I'm missing out on something.On occasions you can later pick the other option too in one run, but lock yourself away from certain areas.On the other hand, you can just replay the mission. So maybe I'm just picky.The new mechanics take much longer than the old ones. For example: C-3P0 consoles are now pretty much used for at least two classes and require you to solve a little minigame, which just takes up time and doesn't add other than that.Something I also noticed is, how little you have to build or solve puzzles in the main missions. It comes down to destroying objects and killing bad guys.Overworld:I'm very sure the game has been centered around the overworld, which I still really enjoy exploring.I think I spend over an hour just exploring Tatooine. Watching all the NPCs minding their business, reacting to me and finding hidden places. This I guess is the only reason I continue to play.Even if I talk ♥♥♥♥ about some of the animations later on, most of them are very well made. The reactions of the NPCs, their expression, movement etc. All looks very much alive and fitting.For example: shivering, weapon spinning, gestureBacktracking is usually very annoying to me, but the game offers you multiple routes for side quests. You can choose between different approaches and walk back a way other than you came from.Bugs/Performance/Unfinished stuff:What I noticed upon arriving in Mos Espa, are sometimes missing or bad facial animations. After speaking with 2-3 NPCs, I noticed how often the camera wasn't showing the NPCs face. I'm very sure this was an attempt to save up some animations on the NPCs faces. It isn’t that bad, just something that instantly struck me.Performance wise, I have little to no problems.I read about people having 30XX card and very bad fps.I play with a 3090 and 5900X and get consistently about 240fps with full-hd. Cards load is about 50%, CPU is not even feeling it. I also have other programs running in the background.Funny enough, performance has been the first thing I noticed.Because I though and still think the game is well optimized for today’s standard. On some occasions you see enemies pop in or objects disappear. But they still did a good job on that part.Aside from some missing/bad animations; the game also feels rushed. Especially in the main story. It is definitely not normal if a mission just has 2 to 3 sections. Get in, solve 2 puzzles, get out. Feels very cheap.The controls are also sometimes a pain in the ass. If I want to put my civilized weapon away, I very often unintentionally throw random people around. Switching between the characters is borderline annoying. Very often they are just miles behind me. For whatever reason they don’t seem to teleport. If you need one of your allies, you often have run the same length again, you just did with your main character, because everyone else thinks it is a great idea to wait 3 buildings away.No black screen, no crashes, etc. so far (Original Trilogy).Heavy fps drops in cutscenes thocomplete saga: 8,5/10skywanker saga: 5/10 for me so far

author: blyzardbeast
review: the whole game is just a movie with quick time events that you cant lose n the missions are short like less than 5 minutes for most the bosses are not hard at all i sat for 20 minutes in one of the QTEs you have to spam a certain button to fill the circle up and nothing happened its possible to make a game for kids and make it difficult just because its for kids doesn't mean you have to make it literally impossible to lose.  i remember playing the old LSW (complete saga and 3) games and getting stuck.  why isn't this the same i want to feel challenged and if i don't there is no satisfaction

author: Sorys
review: God I so wanted this to just be a good update to the original lego star wars games. I grew up playing the very first and second lego star wars games as well as the complete saga. I wanted this to be kinda how the complete saga was for the first and second games with some graphics modernisation. It very much isnt.Pros:- Graphically it is an awesome update and great to sight see- Combat is a bit more indepth than the original games* (check cons on block)- Sound is as good as ever for star wars- Animating the lips moving on the characters even during mission as well as when they exert themselves is greatCons:- After you do a handful of the Kyber bricks you start to realise how daunting of a challenge the collection of all of them is going to be on top of the minikits and red bricks from original games- Story missions frankly suck. they are so compressed and dumb down that it is a real shame. Evidently i have not played through much of the game but having read a few other reviews it just goes to show how much of an issue it is- They removed the block button? I know this sounds a bit weird but timing blocks as a jedi was always cool now it kinda just seems like it auto deflects back to the person shooting. you use to have to time that?- The great graphics kinda seem like window dressing. There is a distinct feel of emptiness to the large areas which feel like they are trying to make up with good graphics but it just comes across like putting lipstick on a pig- Frame drops happen. this will no doubt be fixed for the most part but it does happen- Losing the ability to create custom characters. This one was really weird for me why would you remove something that worked and was fun such a bizarre one- Why make it rpg like with the skill tree upgrade? this just makes it so much more complicated than it needed to be. Why on earth make lego star wars into something it is not? Kyber Bricks were a bad add. All this has done is shift what was already mostly available in the game through red bricks and made them separate. - Finally doing what all open world/ open world lite games like this one do, and that is create unnecessary busy work to complete the gameThe only time I would recommend this game is if the complete saga version is not being sold, you have never played the complete saga and this is on sale for half the price they are currently charging. Sorry TT i know you guys poured your heart and soul into this one and were forced to deal with stupid crunch to get it done but this is a miss. Sadly think this is gonna be the last we see of lego star wars for a long time if not until disney decides to reboot the franchise which i doubt they will do with the TV shows they are churning out for the foreseeable future

author: Monos
review: Alright, alright, here me out.  I played the crap out of the original LEGO Star Wars, and my feelings on this one are very mixed. I really like the new combo systems, and the skill trees are nice.  The humor lands surprisingly well for the target demographic as well (most of the time).  However, some of the levels have REALLY bad stuttering issues.  In one of the levels in episode 2, my usual ~100 fps dropped to 30 or less, and no matter what settings I changed, I couldn't improve it.  Besides performance, some of the "boss" encounters are SO bland that I actively got frustrated.  Very noticeable when facing Dooku twice in a row, then Grievous right after that.  Every fight is just take them down a bit, they run away, you face some trash enemies, do some simple puzzle, and they rejoin the fight.  I know it's to prevent you from just bursting them down and destroying any buildup, but it's still aggravating.I tried to get a refund, but I played too long to get one (since nostalgia wanted to give it a fair shake), so I will most likely eventually finish the game, and maybe the later episodes have a real upswing in quality, but for now, my review will remain negative.  Maybe if I notice an effort to fix performance, and the later areas are more engaging, I'll revisit it.

author: Gene Takavic
review: Fun enough to mess around in playing split-screen, otherwise found the game to be a half-baked, overly simple mess.The puzzles are usually insultingly easy, the improvements to the combat mechanics over previous LEGO games are all in vain, as combat presents no challenge whatsoever. Original LEGO Star Wars games contained all of the gameplay mechanics a game like this could ever make use of. What's "improved" in this game is a failed attempt at reinventing the wheel, so to speak. Nothing is particularly well-tuned in this game, either. Tons of unimaginative mini-games, very weak space combat, and wonky 3rd-person shooting mechanics. This is overly complicating the traditional LEGO game formula, through-and-through.I believe if you're on the fence with this game, you're better off saving your money and grabbing The Complete Saga instead. No amount of new bells and whistles in this game can top the beautiful simplicity of classic LEGO Star Wars.*Update: I also forgot to mention the game has soft-locked on me twice in loading screens, and my fairly powerful PC is unable to keep the game playing at a solid 60FPS. Downright poorly optimized, at this time.

author: King Link
review: Returning the LEGO series to where it should be. I’ve played almost every LEGO game, and the more recent entries haven’t been as good, especially adding voice lines from the movies, or adhering a bit too much to the existing media.  LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga breaks with that trend and delivers an incredible game.   This is almost a full circle, bringing the series back to what started the modern LEGO Franchise games with Star Wars once again, and yet delivering an excellent experience for fans. Levels here focus on more than the original movies, like seeing parts of the original battle in New Hope ship from Leia and Captain Antilles' view.  There are 23 worlds you can free roam around including multiple locations.  There are mini-levels, open-world segments, tons of collectibles, and 300 characters from the games.  The amount of effort that went into this game is incredible.  I also appreciate that there’s still some good humor in the game even though it’s following the original stories, which is something the series has lacked for a bit.Though I am going to be just a touch negative. As good as everything is, a decent amount of the open world of the game is not LEGO, and that is why it looks great, but it also feels like cheating when it’s an environment almost any other game could be set in.  The majority of the game is like the previous LEGO titles, though there’s also a feeling like it’s a third-person shooter at times which is an odd change at first. Pick this up if you’ve liked previous LEGO games or Star Wars.  This revived my love for both of those fandoms and I’m happy to see a LEGO game like this, I’m only wondering where are they going to take this next.  I hope they revisit Harry Potter, Marvel, or DC with this style because there’s so much potential for the future with this.  I picked this up on Steam as well after playing a bit, also, Han shot first. Period.I covered this game as part of the Game Pass for December 2022, if you enjoyed this review or want to know what I think of other games on Game Pass, check out the full review on or subscribe to my Youtube channel:
