author: CmFive
review: Okay, while I will re-review this once I get 100% completion, here are my thoughts:The new on-foot levels are really fun! But also way too short, and the vehicle levels (like Complete Saga) suck. What this ends up meaning is, since half of the levels are vehicle, and the rest of the levels are only ~5m long, you get not a lot of interesting game play in the story mode.The hub worlds are absolutely great. I love how the fact that there are no flying characters forces you to think about how to traverse vertically! They're all beautiful, and collecting Kyber Bricks is so much fun! The only detractor is... The missions. Very few of them are creative, and there are so many of them that after a while you feel like you're doing the same 3-5 uninspired missions on repeat for hours on end.So, if all future LEGO games are like this, would I complain? Well, it depends... I would really be fine either way, but if they do continue in this style, I'm going to want some changes.- Longer Levels and put less of it in the Hub WorldSo many parts of the story that could be part of a level, or a level by itself, are just short romps in the Hub world. What does this mean? No collectibles, and less direction. Ugh.- More Character VarietyOkay, I might sound a bit crazy here, because there are like, 384923840284902384 characters in this game, but they all follow the same couple of archetypes, and they seem to never stray from them. The only way characters in the same 'class' differ from each other is in appearance and the very occasional extra move.- Just Ditch the Vehicle Levels, PleaseThey weren't fun in Complete Saga. They weren't fun in Clone Wars. They're not fun here. Get rid of them.- Don't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Sell a Deluxe Edition Promising all the DLC and then Sell More Without The Deluxe Owners Getting Any of Iti think this one's self explanatory. speaking of DLC,- Level DLC & Character Voice LinesI'm going to be honest, Not the biggest fan of this game's DLC. It's overpriced and only adds a few characters. The only ones I played as at all were Ahsoka and Mando. Please, if you're going to make us pay for DLC, at least throw some levels (and maybe even some HUB worlds) in there.I think this game is very fun, but far from perfect. If future LEGO games are like this, there need to be some changes. Worth the purchase if you love either Star Wars or LEGO Games.

author: DBR
review: This game is fun, but in some levels (droid factory) performance can drop to an unplayable 15 fps at 1080p ON MY RTX 3070. There's no reason I should get less performance than a nintendo switch on any level with my hardware. Hopefully there will be a bug fix or driver update soon and I would love to change my review to positive when that happens. For now, I can't play a game that kills my GPU harder than Cyberpunk 2077. Months after release and the developers seem to have no interest in fixing stability issues. I did 100% this game and for the most part I enjoyed it. This review will remain negative though since Endor is literally unplayable by any standards. FIX YOUR GAMEUpdate: At some point, long after I already completed this game, the developers finally got around to patching the performance issues. This game runs fine now and I can endorse it in its current state. Disregard previous comments about Endor/Droid Factory performance as they have been fixed.

author: Hekteur
review: TLDR version:Pros:- Great graphic and animations.- Epic soundtrack (Star Wars soundtrack, duh)- Great tone and humor- Makes the bad episodes bearable- Almost infinite Side Quests and collectables- Open World Exploration is epic with the amount of detail present in the game.Cons:- Low difficulty.- Upgrades feel useless (due to a low difficulty)Long versionThis is simply the best Lego game I've played. It also have the merit of making episode 1-2-7-8-9 funny and enjoyable. If you want a quick ride, it's possible to storm through all 9 episodes quite fast, but if you like a very long ride, know that getting 100% on all episodes and in all the open areas will take a long while. The game isn't hard so character upgrades feel kind of useless. The game remains fun and filled with objectives long after the main campaign (all 9 episodes) is completed. Don't expect a challenge though, it's a very easy game. This makes it, on the other hand, very accessible. Both young kids and adults can have fun and it seems to be the intention of the dev (to make dads play with their kids).

You cannot replay the stuff in between missions the way you did the first time.

author: Grand General Mark Gilbert
review: It really does pain me to write this but the game is just a hollow shell. The stories of the films have been reduced to the absolute minimum with tiny, buggy levels. Barely any character uniqueness as they all fall under set classes, characters in each class share the same exact abilities no matter what the character is. Most of the game is you just running from point A to point B with little to no combat, building, or anything. I had to refund it, it is not worth the full price tag. I don't even know how much it would be worth on sale as it stands. And I do doubt that a lot of these problems will be fixed as they seem to be core aspects of the game play now. Don't waste your money here, buy the Complete Saga. it still has heart.

author: NCaldwell28
review: Most people have already played this game by now so most of you know the good already. I don't see many people mentioning the things that kind of suck the fun out of this game for me and even my children. My son actually plays the original complete saga w/out dialogue more than this game. I think the main reason is that you (the player) never really get the time to enjoy what you're doing in the game. Go to from point A to B then ten minutes later a movie and then another movie and then another movie. The game has terrible pacing issues when it comes to the levels. I really enjoy the open world, optional dialogue, and overall game play. I just wish the devs wouldn't have held the players hand so much along missions. As soon as you feel like everything is in your control a cut scene occurs and messes with the pacing. When my kid doesn't enjoy it as much as the older generation of games I know there's something lacking. This is the best looking Lego game to ever release and he would still prefer to go to the older one and enjoy a real level without cut scene after cut scene. Not bad enough to give a thumbs down, but the devs missed the mark on the cut scenes.

author: Jayllax
review: The gameplay is fun and the puzzles, though some waayy too easy, are fun to figure out aswell. And the galaxy with all the planets is amazing. They really didn't hold back on enviroments. It's crazy how much work was put into these different open world areas. But I sadly can't recommend the game until they have fixed all of the game breaking bugs. This includes bugs that:- Breaks progression- Breaks missions- Breaks sound and video- Causes crashes- Puts you in story mode instead of free play mode so you have to reset a level multiple timesI think if you are a casual player who isn't looking to 100% the game, then it probably won't be too much of a problem, but for someone like me who has 100%'d all of the LEGO games I have played (last time I played one was 8 years ago though), it is really frustrating to have all of these glitches, bugs and crashes.It's in a really bad state at the moment, for me at least. So until they have fixed that, I wouldn't recommend the game for a completionist or hardcore LEGO games fan.EDIT:Lots of bugs are now fixed! Def recommend it now!

author: MischivousMic
review: This is clearly made by enthusiasts. The star wars details are all there, so are many extra jokes and refrences. I am already a massive fan of this game.  I've encountered a couple bugs, nothing game breaking, but I'm willing to overlook fish flying through the atmosphere in Otoh Gunga, clipping through the walls. Update after an additional 45 hours of gameplay: I have encountered a few severe bugs that are stopping me from finishing the story. There is a community workaround for some but not all, I would have to say this is majorly detracting from my otherwise gleaming experience with this game. I really would like to be able to continue the story without starting it over, and finish my side quests, no matter where I stopped progression in them last. We're down to about an 8/10 with these bugs, before I hit the major ones I was feeling like 9.8/10. The lego experience really is excellent most times, this is a step above their already solid reputation. I have barely scratched the surface of this immense game, I can't wait to see what else is in store.

author: beantown567
review: I love LEGO Star Wars games, but this one is way to buggy. Just naming a few bugs I have encountered; game crashes, frozen bosses that you can't kill, unable to move, you players don't even spawn in, getting trapped inside elevators, getting stuck in hyperspace. I hardly experienced any bugs on my first play through, but when I started to replay missions to 100% the game I had to play some missions 3+ times while hoping I wouldn't run into any game breaking bugs. I can't even beat episode 7's last mission because the game crashes every single time. This game should've been delayed to iron out the overwhelming amount of bugs. Please devs, we would rather you fix bugs than try to squeeze money out of us releasing DLC (not hating on the DLC, just want way less bugs).Update on review after almost a month of not playing: still running into all the same bugs. I will  most likely not be picking this game up again.TL;DR: Good game (if it'll let you play), way too many bugs

author: Sinjin The Monke
review: Lego star wars has come a long way since i last touched the series back in the late 2000s.It goes through all the main entries in the series as one would hope. I find it funny how they sometimes manage to cram multiple sequences from the films into a less than 30 seconds cutscene, the brevity of some of the lines makes it almost comical (which sometimes is clearly the intent others not so much) speaking of comedy alot of the gags here are pretty good, simple but good which is what you'd want from a game taking its wide range of audience seriously. While not a beat for beat retelling if you are a fan you know exactly whats going on, if you aren't well...there are worse ways to figure out the story.Controls feel good for the most part, vehicle segments can be somewhat jarring but thats just something to adapt to, fighting feels pretty good if simple. On the plus side its often quite flashy which makes up for the fact that you're only hitting at most 3 button combos on people. Shooting feels...surprisingly fun i've played AAA entries with worse mechanics.The interface is a bit on the cluttered side but i have yet to find a SW game that doesn't have a cluttered HUD for some reason. Fortunately most of the clutter is things that will fade off (hints, info etc) menu controls are fairly complex which can be a problem at first but soon you figure out how it all functions.Sound and music are spot on as one would hope of a SW entry. Not just the music but the blaster effects, ship engines, background noises and voices all feel very star wars.Gameplay is...easy...way too easy most of the time ngl. Dying has next to no consequence which some might be put off by, i feel like the devs simply wanted people to enjoy the setting and story and not let anything else get in the way of that fun.The puzzles however can range a good deal on the difficulty scale with a few surprisingly tough ones to figure out but nothing ever too extreme. There is a massive array of side content to explore and do as well as a myriad of unlocks whether it be ships, characters or the like.The excessive amount of DLC for the game seems a little off putting but at least the offerings aren't just cheap reskins, many come with their own unique move sets and abilities though you can only make use of most of these in the free play mode which makes sense.

author: maxz
review: This is a great game and my heart feels at home while playing it, due to the accurate portrayal of the Star Wars universe, the great music and atmosphere.It feels nice to recognize certain buildings from the movies or other Star Wars games e.g. the Theed spaceport.I also appreciate the Lego slapstick humor and it has so far always been used in a sensible manner e.g. not spoiling emotional scenes.TT Games also integrated many Star Wars related memes into the game.I would appreciate if they added the possibility to create custom characters, Bothans and a pilotable Mon Calamari Cruiser.Although the character creation which was in the previous game is missing and there are some minor bugs (e.g. collectibles for a side quest not being counted properly until a restart), I can wholeheartedly recommend Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga.

author: Conrad Larson
review: It's a Lego Star Wars game. It should be amazing, but it's let down.1. The game is buggy. From character selection to missions not allowing you to complete. Mostly minor apart from the Maz's castle bug, but they're frequent and annoying enough to kill your drive to keep playing.2. The actual story missions are too short and too few. The focus is on the open world which, while great, means there's not a lot of cool stuff to do with the characters you unlock. Especially since enemies end up not spawning anymore.3. No character creator. It's a let down because with this game's class system we could've had the best way to choose what your character can do.If they fix the numerous issues with the gameplay then this will be a straight recommend. Until then I can't encourage devs to think this is acceptable.

author: Pulsating Prostate
review: This game is a buggy mess.  Have had to go back to main menu just to fix the endless amount of glitchy crap.  The mechanics are sloppy and frustrating.  I have soft locked it few times just by doing actions too quickly.  The game needs multiple patches.  Even the landscape is frustrating to navigate.  Basically no story.  Just random bits from the movies.  I do not recommend at all until the devs fix this mess of a bug infested game. Just play the other Lego games.  Much better quality.  I always recommend the Marvel and DC ones.

author: SixSix_
review: BUY THE ORIGINAL COPIES OF THE EPISODES!This all feels rushed, the story is rushed, the combat feels awful, the camera does whatever it wants to do, the UI is monstrous and I've disabled most of it & the upgrade system is based on whether you will replay the game which I can guarantee I wont be doing or finishing.Story content, combat, interactions ALL feel incredibly lacklustre.Some of my most frustrated moments in in gaming aren't even in these episodes. Sorry, they are, but they are 10 second cut-scenes and you're already 30 minutes into the movie timeline without touching a button.Boss fights are a button mash, everything is drawn out for you, none of the feelings from the original episodes, like dodging Jango Fetts missiles on Kamino, throwing missiles back. Jump, dodge, smack 2-3 times and you're already another 30min fast forwarded.I've looked forward to this as a "Remastered" edition of all episodes, running through doors for different chapters to each movie with 4K HDR perfection, but this is a big open world mess. Maybe it works for the younger generation but it has lost the entirety of its charm from when I was growing up.I'm sorry but this isn't the release I'd hoped for.

author: Semarc
review: Let me start by saying that i was a huge fan of the Complete Sage Game. It was one of my favourite childhood game and i played countless hours to get that game to 100% completion. I really like Lego Star Wars III (The Clone wars game) too. And compared to those games, especially compared to the Complete Sage, this game is just disappointing. there are certainly good things about this game but I'm writing this review to complain about what I don't like, so yeah.Disclaimer away, here we go:1.) The characters are boring. The game divides the characters into different classes (Jedi, bounty hunters, Villains, protocol droids, etc.). And every character in those classes plays exactly the same. And one character only ever belongs to one class. there are no characters that can do multiple things outside of their one narrow class, no, a few abilities are gouroped together in one class and there is nothing outside that rigid system. They had better system with characters that can do multiple things and are not just copies of one another in the previous games, so this is literally a step back. But i think i know why they did it, because of the levelling system:2.) The Character levelling feels kinds out of place. I can't even say exactly why, but somehow, levelling up procotol droids is not what i had envisioned from this game. And you know the developers themselves didn't quite know what to do with the system because multiple classes just have "You get studs when you use some ability" as an option for levelling. Truly riveting gameplay.3.) The Openworld is nice, but gets boring after a while. The open world certainly is nice, but its just too big. There are more than a thousand kyber crystals (the replacement for the golden bricks in the previous games), and over two thirds of those are in the open world. Some of the crystals are hidden behind nice puzzles, but a lot are just "Switch too this character class (remember, all characters are the same inside of those ten boxes) and use one ability." That in itself is not bad, but after a while that just gets boring. and I don't even get why they would do it like that. I mean, yeah, its good advertising if you can say that players can go through this big overworld but if that overworld is filled with tons and tons of the same kind of "puzzles" with just a few good ones in between, you are better of making a smaller but actually fun world to explore.4.) The levels are very short. I get that the point is to spend more time in the overworld and less time in the levels, but still, with the levels being *that* short, it just feels lackluster. This goes together with the last point; the levels should have been longer and the overworld smaller.5.) Space combat is fun. Okay I lied, I will say some good things about the game. The space combat is really good, and certainly better than in the last two games. being able to use the full 360° of space makes it feel really nice and dog fighting with tie fighters is just fun. It is a bit easy. yes, but nonetheless a lot of fun.6.) The humour is good. I feel like there is less of it than in the Complete Saga, but that might be me misremembering the old games too, but the humour that is there is really good, they really nailed that feeling of the Lego game humour. There are a bunch of other things i haven't mentioned, both good and bad, but still, while this game does have certain aspects really nailed down, others are just sooo lacking. The game is just a bit of a slog with some really good passages mixed in between, but overall the goods sadly doesn't outweigh the good. And I think that's sad. I really wanted to like this game, I was really excited for this game from the day it was released, so this is just disappointing.

author: Vagabond43
review: This game is great, it feeds my childhood nostalgia perfectly and i enjoy collecting every last resource. However, like a large number of players on this game there are a number of game breaking bugs. Bugs that shouldnt be in the game, bugs that would 100% be fixed if it let you use manual saves and using multiple auto saves for each collectable. After over 70 hours i have lost my save. This is my warning to you. Do not buy this game. It is a waste of your money and time because of these issues. There is ZERO EXCUSE to have such issues especially with the love the developers have put into the game. However because of this i urge you to never fast travel during a story mission. I collected an item for a side quest on one area of a planet and it gave me the popup to teleport to hand it in. I stupidly pressed A by mistake. Due to this, i am locked out of progressing the prequel trilogy as i cant even transport to the other side of the planet. Other planets have taxis that let you go from one area to another. Naboo does not have any. If it does they arent loading for me. I wish I could get a refund for this game as it is a joke that something like this happens in a game with a budget such as this. But oh well, i have to grit my teeth and bear it. Thanks Developers for wasting 70 hours of my life, You guys are great.

author: melon
review: I think it's important to start with the fact that I 100% completed the game before writing this review. I didn't think that it would be fair to write a negative review like this unless I experienced everything this game has to offer. As a Star Wars fan, and as someone who has a lot of nostalgia for the older games, I couldn't help but enjoy playing the game. However, the game is so brain dead easy that I could feel myself drooling throughout my playthrough. It is chock full of padding, and just straight up non gameplay that I don't think this is an experience for someone new to Lego games or Star Wars can enjoy. I know this is a game for kids, and I don't expect every game to be Dark Souls level difficulty, but it's pathetic how much of this game can be skipped, failed, or played with your eyes closed and still win. They made an effort to make the combat more complex, but made the enemy encounters so easy that it's impossible to die, and you can just stand and press X over and over again with your eyes closed. You can skip/fail the "puzzles" in the game and still win. It's sad. I hate this idea that kid's media doesn't have to be well written, or slightly challenging. The older games were harder than this, but we all look back on them fondly. Kids aren't going to stop playing because it's hard. If they like the game, they'll keep playing. I can't support this game, because there barely is one here.

review: Edit: I was hoping after playing this game for a bit longer I was going to get along with it, however I was wrong. If you are getting this to relive your childhood, like me, then just save your money. It pains me to say that the whole aspect of a lego game, completing each level, has been taken away. Instead it focuses too much on completing small puzzles to reach the so called 'level' which takes about 5 minutes. Don't get me wrong the combat mechanics are great, but there's just not really enough opportunities to properly use them, (unlike the complete sage or clone wars).Im going to be bold, and probably get a lot of hate for this; it hurts me to do this, but I've got to liken this to no mans sky: Its wider than the pacific ocean, but not deep enough to drown in.

author: Eshaanisaloser
review: Being a massive fan of Star Wars and a fan of LEGO games, I was thoroughly excited for The Skywalker Saga. Unfortunately it did not live up to the hype. While the graphics, character roster, and open world are amazing, the missions just feel vague and unimportant. After playing through the The Phantom Menace and about halfway through Attack of the Clones, I quickly realized that a majority of the levels/missions were just walking from one place to the other. There are very few actual levels. Instead, there are much more "levels" at greatly reduced lengths (mostly walking) as opposed to the traditional LEGO games formula. While the upgrades brought in this game are huge, it feels like TT Games went too far Triple A with this release and forgot its roots. It doesn't feel like a LEGO game anymore where I can just sit back and relax. While that may be great for some, it was disapointing to me

author: Ckaiadn
review: Graphically, there's no denying how much of an upgrade this is. The problem is everything else. Story mode is incredibly short and and the bits in between generally consist of being a glorified walking simulator. Voice acting ranges from decent to inaccurate/terrible. When going around in free play I experienced a crash when I was stood still doing nothing. There's a jumping glitch where the character literally cannot jump over obstacles, which is kinda important in a platformer game ya know?I think the production hell this game went through shows. The complete saga is around £17 with a good balance between story and free play. This game is £50 with very little to the story, not to mention having quite a few glitches, some of which make the game almost unplayable. Did anyone bug test this game? I really want to like it but jesus christ, fix your game or at least delay it to get rid of these horrible glitches.

author: vapidkourt
review: To say my feelings are mixed is an understatement, this doesn't so much feel like a lego starwars game and instead a lego game set in the starwars world. The gameplay has gone from parking under a sewerage treatment pipe to parking under a waterfall with a small amount of urine in it and it looks about as pretty as a game about plastic soul suckers can, but that's not what the lego games live on, they live on charm, a zany sense of fun and a deep love for the work in question. Tcs was so full of charm that practically every decision gave a laugh that left a deep warmness, a human touch of love, as this seems to be cynical jokes about sand and corporate, dead behind the eyes cynicism, which is miserable, I wanted this game to make me giggle like a kid again like the first did, but instead we're stuck with a dead eyed, watery knockoff that feels so thinly spread that the sheen off butter that is on the continent sized piece of bread barely even graces my taste buds.Puzzles are hard to find and easy to solve, making them relatively ok if you can stomach repetition and the feeling that someone is trying to steal your wallet. 4/10, only play if you've never touched a woman and would become a concubine for mickey mouse given the choice.

author: Jerry Phoenix
review: OK, that's enough. I really can't continue playing the game like this. First of all, I got the game as a gift and I'm very glad I didn't spend any money on it. I feel sorry for the person who gave it to me though. It's a waste of money.About me: I've played every LEGO Star Wars game out there and quite a few Star Wars games more. I know every film, the series, comics, books and have been a fan since I was little.But what I'm offered here is an insolence.On the positive aspects.+ The game is really pretty+ It's not the rigid LEGO game it used to be, a little more dynamic, camera work works a little betterbut unfortunately that was it with positives.neutral pointsBut there is nothing else worth mentioning here either.And so on to the negatives... and oh boy, there's quite a bit we need to talk about.- first of all the intro, if you load the game and skip the intro, you still ALWAYS hear the last sentence from Rei and that's really annoying for me personally- when I load the game, it happens that I get 2 loading screens in a row, it's poorly optimized- The gameplay itself is also poorly optimized, there are tons of bugs, I can't keep up with reporting them all while playing without becoming an unpaid tester. If you try to climb with the lightsaber, it can happen that the pathfinding fails completely and the character does not reach his goal, the only thing that helps is reloading. Doesn't always work.- an important point for me is the creativity of the game. There are many repetitive passages where you have to follow an NPC to progress the story. Mini-games are repetitive, collectibles are a ridiculous number, and key gameplay principles that TT Games implemented years ago in LEGO Star Wars The Clone Wars would have been ideal here, but are completely absent- Instead, a lot of attention is paid to "boss fights" (if you want to call them that). These are ridiculous. EVERY boss, without exception, can be defeated in well under 5 minutes simply by repeatedly throwing his lightsaber at his head. This is NOT how good gameplay works!- another minus point is the implementation of the space battles, the control of the spaceships is stiff and sometimes clumsy. In fast passages you quickly lose track because the opponents rotate in the player and are therefore not accessible, except through an unnecessarily large loop. Otherwise you cannot get behind the opponent.- The content of the game is generally not correct. With 3 triologies, I expect more than 15 hours of gameplay for the story. In order to stretch the time, unnecessarily long passages with repetitive content were built in, which simply take away the desire to play.I think I could go on ranting like this forever, but I think you get the point. Maybe I have too high expectations because I compare the game to other games and I expect too much myself. OK. Taking that out, however, we still have a way too buggy game that doesn't provide good entertainment at the expense of fanservice. Ultimately, this game has taken all the flaws of the sequel trilogy/anti-triology and lost the spirit of Star Wars and LEGO Star Wars in particular. I'm taking a break from this game for the time being and stepping back to get a clear view of it from the outside.Until then I can only advise you:If you're a fan of the LEGO Star Wars games, stay away from the Skywalker trilogy.If you're expecting this full-price title to be mature, stay away.And if you get bored easily with repetitive sequences... hands off.I hope TT Games will deliver again, so it's just sad what the game has become. May my opinion be a little help when you decide whether to buy the game yourself and may the force be with you.

author: Lunch
review: Its definitely good as a Lego game, its really fun with lots to collect, not only characters but items and bricks and extras. Story content wise, it is cut down more than you'd expect, because they're trying to fit a 2 hour movie into a 30 minute session, and that's for each movie in here. Some movies are shorter than others, Attack of the Clones and Empire Strikes Back are some of the shortest in the whole game. There's also instances of favoritism with the Original Trilogy, which I don't mind, but the prequels feel rushed compared to the amount of time spent on perfecting the OT. Character voices are really good, with a lot of Clone Wars TV actors coming back to finish the rest of the Clone Wars era with this game, Matt is a good Anakin, and whoever did Ben Kenobi's voice in the OT is amazing, its like a complete analogue of the original actor.Visually this game is outstanding, I can run the game on ultra and it runs so buttery smooth, the *only* problem is the sections in Attack of the Clones in the Geonosian droid plant where they do a picture in picture view of two characters in two different areas, and it quadruples the load of the game and slows my FPS from 120 to 20 fps, it was really bad and no graphical option I chose could fix it. Thankfully it was only one level in the entire series.   Apparently there's a bug where the game just ceases to function and your save gets corrupted if you go to Maz's Bar in episode 7, GOOD glad I didn't play further yet.The intro of the game is really annoying when you start it up, always having to skip the intro cutscene, and always having Rey say "I need someone, to show me my place in all this" and its really really REALLY cringey. I don't mind the sequel trilogy for how dumb it is to the rest of the movies canon, but having her be the center of the "Skywalker Saga" is really lame and not deserved. I sometimes wish the UI was a bit better showing secondary objectives, the general collectibles UI is blue but the secondary objectives color is the same kind of blue and its easy to get lost. Some side objectives aren't straight forward from the voiced/text encounter and you need to just pay attention to the galaxy map on where to go. Even if its on the same planet, its hard to find banana man on Yavin 4 because there's thousands of similar looking troopers on 5 to 6 different floors.No bonus areas like at the end of the original "complete saga" game, so we miss out on content that could have been unique to each episode. No golden bricks either, its all Kyber bricks now which is just to pad out the upgrade system.Speaking of which the upgrade system is kinda worthless? I only picked a few general upgrades but didn't really pick ones that were on a specific tree, I usually just stuck to villian, sith, Jedi, Hero and General. I'm sure I'll upgrade more eventually with there being 1100 kyber bricks, but it just feels like padding for paddings sake and no real reason to have any of these artificial downgrades. The music is really good, and its exactly John Williams score in each movie, but I wish there was a "streamer mode" in which it'd go back to a Lego Star Wars DS sounding soundtrack (See this video playlist:  that was free to use to streamers so we didn't have to get Disney copyrights on our YT channels. A small thing, but it would have gone a long way, and added to the charm of Lego.It would have been cool to have an extra that would change the graphics to the original Lego Star Wars Graphics mode, where it would have gave everything a more smooth look and less intense graphics settings to bring back some memories. Or even have the ability to change to their old skins from the complete saga.I wish there was an actual HUB area like in the original Lego Star Wars Complete saga, thats where a lot of us old folks had memories and nostalgia, it could have been a space port or the Mos Eisley bar. Something would have been nice, any hub area, maybe allow us to customize it too, with customizable characters which is again not in this either.There's a lot of weird censorship in this version of Star Wars Lego, they don't directly show any deaths, they cut away if something unavoidable happens like Qui-Gon, and it just shows him pass out. Padme doesn't say she's pregnant, just that "something wonderful has happened", her "death" isn't even shown, Anakin just accidentally hits her on the head with the wedding cake topper and that's what did her in after childbirth, which is a MASSIVE problem because that re-contextualizes how Leia and Luke got split up in the first place, they don't go with their "not dead" mother, they get split up intentionally by the Jedi and Organa. They're really not wanting to show Leia get hit on by any male character and instead gets replaced by C3P0 in a wig, or even the reverse where she can't hit on Luke by saying "you're a little short for a stormtrooper", instead its just some rat droid with a stormtrooper helmet. That being said though, its for the kids. I can see why they changed it, they don't want a child possibly feeling something bad about their favorite character dying and want to make sure everyone is happy and okay and nothing happens. In fact they skip Alderan's destruction for some reason even though even in the original movie there's nothing but Vader and Tarkin and Leia being distraught over a PNG exploding.There are sections in the open world hubs where you can clearly switch to characters like in Free Play, even though the game didn't explicitly say it was in Free Play, so I would skip over collectibles not knowing I could have save myself time by doing them early. Mumble mode is a cool addition for 10 minutes and then you switch it off because the cutscenes don't really have much of their charm without the voices. They would need to redo the cutscenes entirely to get the same level of charm the original Lego games had. This game feel more like Mario Oddessey than a Lego star wars game, with the different controls and the amount of collectibles, its just way too much for one person to do, its kinda overbearing. Not hard to do, but just time consuming. The only other change I really want is more Clone Wars characters, like Ahsoka in the roster of the game.I do recommend this game to any Lego fans, you will get your money's worth over this and especially since its $50 and not $60 its a more reasonable price, def check for prices elsewhere than here if you want something closer to $40.

author: blindwatchman0722
review: This game fails to entertain and glosses over so many good parts of the movies to the point where you're left wondering why you're even playing. In terms of story, they could have done so much to flesh the movies out and dive a little deeper into the source material. Instead, they chose to include EVEN LESS than previous games, mainly The Complete Saga (a game so small and dated I can play it on my iPhone) and instead stuff in some jokes. I'm not saying the games can't be funny at times but why are we IGNORING important plot points to make the game more suitable to children. Did the creators miss the fact that Star Wars was made with children in mind already?Real talk: the game is mostly walking to and from places with very few puzzles or interactive gameplay in between and boss fights. That's really it. Sure, there's stuff to explore and collectables to find but if you're just interested in playing through the story, you're looking at maybe three hours to get through the prequel trilogy (assuming you don't run into hiccups in the boss battles or get side tracked by asteroids).Perhaps I'm simply biased and am lashing out like some old coot but this game blows. It's really great at making you want to play a different, more immersive Star Wars game though.Oh, and Rei is the main feature of the title screen and always says a dumb quote before you start so that's great. As if anyone wanted that, or to be told that Rei is the most important character and that everyone else is beneath her. It's literally just her at the top of a tower of other minifigs. E p i c.

author: stupidgoober
review: I was excited about this game but its a huge disappointment for me. all the levels feel rushed and too short they skip out on some that scenes that could be incredible. when I reached episode 3 i was super excited for the opening fighter scene as that was my favourite level in the last saga game. but nope its a 30 second cut-scene and that's it. I wasn't expecting the same game as last time with the same levels but I was definitely expecting more. I know its more movies but still its just not enough. all the main missions in the game feel super short, its not fleshed out and most of them can be finished super fast with almost no secrets or easter eggs to find they needed to be significantly longer. also there's no extra dumb levels that were super fun like in the last. theres hardly any room to mess around. there is just no replay value for these. they over do many systems like there is over a thousand bricks to collect and the only reason to replay the levels is to get those but honestly its just not worth doing. and later you get an ability that tells you exactly where all the secrets are. that ability also totally clutters up the whole screen. they added a lot of open world areas and these suck they are just huge empty spaces with nothing interesting to do but collect more of the dumb bricks. this could have been cut and they could have just added a canteen space or something like that maybe a ship a single ship that is open to explore where they could fill that with secrets instead of 30 massive empty open areas. although I like the combat system for lightsaber bosses and some others the combat is slow and clunky I feel like there are significantly less enemies than other games and its because of the more focused fighting now. also there are micro-transactions in this game and that is that prevent you from using certain characters. and there's no custom characters like wtf that has always been a amazing feature why not add that in. now i haven't played into movie 4-9 yet but if its anything like 1-3 than im going to be super disappointed. I will say though the game does look incredible and I enjoy the voice acting. but I really dont have to much good to say about this game. I give it a 25/100 just disappointing

author: turkeylegs83
review: my info --This game is way too short. Its even shorter than the classic lego star wars.  There are nonstop puzzles that try to make the game larger. The creators focused too hard on making side quest the main purpose instead of the actual famous star wars storyline. "Help c-3p0 find all his butt plugs" and they will be scattered around the map. Like 5 of those in every single room you enter. I could probably beat the game in under 3 hours (im not joking).  Thankfully, You dont have to constantly look around the map for special items to help you out or special quests because all of them are worthless. If you want a game that immerses you in lego but gives you an action-adventure style gameplay,  this is perfect for you. The previous star wars lego games look like they were drawn with my left hand but this game has better graphics than gta 5 jesus christ. They decided not to balance out what they worked on so they spent all their resources making good graphics than surpass god of war and now we only get 32 minutes of gameplay. idk - -This game is designed for people who are obsessed with unlocking star wars characters. Unfortunately I already went through all my dopamnine unlocking all the characters in the last star wars game.

author: Steel Cathedral
review: When I bought this game, I was under the impression that I got to slay younglings. I thought there was a mission where you play as Anakin, newly minted as Darth Vader, storm the Jedi Temple and massacre all the Jedi and get to the room where the kids are hiding and go nuts.I was wrong, what you are able to do in the youngling slaying department, is just attack the ankle bitters in the temple in freeplay. This is basically what you were able to do in the other Lego Star Wars games when you are in the lobby/cantina and run into young Anakin. What is even worse is that this slaying is limited to younglings that do not have conversation options and that is most of them.This game, besides my issue with the younglings, is decent. It also makes the sequel trilogy seem bearable so that's a win in my book. I recommend it.Thank you for reading my review. author: Yamamoto1234
review: Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth Plagueis The Wise? I thought not. It’s not a story the Jedi would tell you. It’s a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise he could use the Force to influence the midichlorians to create life… He had such a knowledge of the dark side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful… the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself.

author: JohnVera
review: I really can't recommend this game at all. not as a game in general, and even less as a Lego franchise game. The selling point of Lego games was "family friendly, co-op, puzzle game" and this is barely co-op at moments and none of the other tags. sure enough, it completely lacks the "puzzle" tag now. I bought this game to play with my little sister and we expended 1 hour figuring out how to make the controllers work, 3 hours figuring out what was actually happening in the game.we played through the entire phantom menace, and all the game was about was literally just run from point A to point B, the only exception being the fight against Darth Maul, and two random "build this loose pieces" (no puzzle, just construct that obvious thing and you are ready) along the way. the game is also absurdly convoluted in the interfaces/HUD, two players, each with his own "mini" map, up to maybe 6 indications markers moving across the screen (for things you likely don't know what they are) HP bars, names of the zone were you are rn, yada yada yada, then there's the fact that the game FORCE you into a vertical splitscreen, no  way to change that so you can't decide for yourself what works best to make the screen less convoluted. All in all, unplayable and boring.

author: Bob
review: After playing until I got 100% on my save file, I can now say this game is not bad but not great either, just average. Many of the puzzles and missions in the open world were repeats of each other or very bland, the only good thing I have to say about the puzzles and missions is maybe the funny name of the mission or the funny line that a npc spews in their dialog during the misson/puzzle. I experienced 4-5 crashes, 3-4 moments where the game refused to load after waiting for 10+ mins, many moments of npcs getting stuck and requiring I restart the puzzle I was doing or moving them in hopes for it to fix itself, and the geonosis factory level and endor open world area for some reason experiencing bad frame drops making them not fun to play around in. I felt disappointed when some major battles from the prequel and original trilogies got left out like the battle of geonosis or the space battle of endor. Overall I feel like if you want to play a average open world game, then go ahead and play this game but I believe this game is very average and you should just go play the older games and stay away from buying this buggy mess of a game.

Mace windu, to his (delusional) fans he is somewhat a god among men but in this game it shows his true skill which is very sub-par to any actual Jedi knights and shows why Mace windu SHOULDN'T be a Jedi Knight, was also very well made showing how Jango fett died,  he was shown as  battered and bruised before coming up against Mace and like a great game this is, it didnt give Mace the killing blow/easy kill he had because he is undeserving of it and i cant help but not praise the game for doing this. author: The Hurricane
review: There's a lot of stuff missing from this game that shouldn't be and a lot of things that are in this game that shouldn't be. DLC characters are voiceless re-skins of other characters minus the personality even though they have the voice actors for many of the characters already.A myriad of bugs that can stop progression or delete saves have went unchecked since release and the inability to replay certain story parts without restarting the entire game feels really weird in 2022.Cant really recommend it unless you really really like Star Wars or you don't mind any of what I just said. There was a lot of potential and it was so close to being great just like a lot of Star Wars games recently. It just fell short sadly. (P.S Rey Skywalker's yellow lightsaber is like a foot and a half shorter than every other lightsaber in the game and that is hilarious)

author: Fllypn't
review: Massive disappointment. Levels are very short and repetitive, 90% of the game is just walking around collecting collectibles, most of the story mode is just watching cutscenes and walking, with levels scattered in between. Clearly most focus was put on the open world, and even there most of it is just very boring repetitive puzzles, not many are great. The visuals look good, but otherwise it's just so bland. I wasted 70 francs on this, could have spent that on some better games that cost a lot less. Why there is so much praise for this game is completely beyond me. You get to play the gooberfish chase but not Windu vs Palpatine. If you want to play through the movies, don't get this. If you like walking around through an open world doing mediocre puzzles to get more and more collectibles, go for it.

This game I was not able to do it as there is no FOV slider in the game, because of that it makes this game unplayable for me. I find this very disappointing as many games that are produced have FOV sliders built in them now. I was forced to return this game after 5 or 10 minutes. Unless they plan to update this game with a way to adjust this I have no plans to buy this game again or anything else that they make. If you have the same problem as me I suggest you not buy this.

author: Chief Keef Soldier
review: Haven't played the sequel trilogy yet, but I doubt my opinion will change on this game.Anyway, if there were an option in between recommending and not recommending the game I'd be in that category. I played the first 2 Lego Star Wars games on the PS2 when I was around 3-5 years old and Lego Star Wars 3 on the 360 so I think I know what I'm talking about (of course I have replayed these games multiple times), and this is nothing like those games which is what I was hoping for. I didn't want a carbon copy, but something similar to the old formula would have been way better than what they were trying to do here. Let me start off with the biggest issue I have with the game which is the "open world". Most planets have hubs or areas you can find mini-kits, brick and complete quests for characters (another problem I'll talk about later). This is the root of the problem from what I can tell. As with most open world games the missions you get or side quests get very repetitive after a while. I really wanted to 100% this game and get all the achievements, but it just seems so boring and tedious to do it that I just don't feel like investing my time into doing that when I could be doing something else. I just don't really like open world games because the ones I've played including this one have repetitive elements, and that's just not fun when done wrong.On to the characters. Before you could just collect studs and buy the characters which I was completely fine with. Now, you have to find the npc that gives the quest for that character unlock (or you can buy the rumor), you complete the quest, and then you have to buy it. Of course because of how many characters and variations of those characters there are it is bound to get repetitive which it does. It just makes me not wso much better and I hope games don't start following this trend because I saw the same problem with Elden Ring. I respect them for trying a different approach to Lego Star Wars, but it just doesn't work here for me unfortunately, and I really tried my best toant to go through the effort of trying to unlock these characters.Puzzles are pretty much non-existent within levels. Yeah sure you'll come across one or two, but most of the time it will be either you have to aim at one of those purple markers where you don't figure out what to shoot instead it literally aims toward what you need to shoot for you, so that isn't fun. Or you have to move a couple blocks in order to climb onto something, or you have to use a console (Astromech, Protocol Droid, and Imperial) which are so simple that I don't even see them as puzzles at all and I think a kid would be able to figure these out very easily as well. The characters will also just straight up tell you what to do most of the time so that gets rid of the challenge that should be there.Another big problem that is very noticeable is the missed opportunity for levels. I'll provide some examples with some comparisons to the first 2 games.I'm sure I'm missing some, but these were the major ones I noticed and can remember (I also picked on Episode 3 a lot because it is my favorite Star Wars movie so yeah), but of course this is likely because they decided to put more resources into the "open world" than into the levels which are more important. I doubt people want to keep doing the same things over and over again just to collect items. On a related note though, sometimes there will be very useless sections where you just walk to the next cutscene, and then leave to the next cutscene.Not very many bugs, but these three I've encountered were annoying.The combat is fun I guess I will say it is definitely better than the other Lego Star Wars games. Only issue I had with it was when using blasters it zooms in so much it gets a little annoying I wish there was an option to reduce the zoom effect, not have it at all, or press a certain button to zoom instead of needing to zoom every time you shoot.The graphics are good looking for a Lego game, but it is 2022 so it's expected.The jokes are honestly funny most of the time. There are references to other media which I found cool most notably Breaking Bad which was referred to twice so far. This gives the game bonus points because I love Breaking Bad.Anyway, in an era of sweaty multiplayer FPS games that I honestly don't bother to play anymore, this is definitely a breath of fresh air because it's so casual, and can be fun at times. Although it does make me want to go back and play the Complete Saga and the Clone Wars because in my opinion those games were better.Honestly, if puzzles are more your thing, and you don't like open world repetitiveness I'd say at least wait for a sale. On the other hand, if you like shooting ♥♥♥♥ and decent lightsaber combat then go ahead and try this game out. I wish the game didn't take the open world route because I can tell it would have been in love with this game if they put in more time into the levels themselves. I was so excited for this game that when I launched it I had the biggest ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ smile I've had in a while. Honestly, if they had added those levels that I mentioned that were missed opportunities (there were more, but I can't think of them right now), and added more puzzles this game would be a 10/10 for me. I still have decent fun with it, but I can't go for more than 2 hours a day playing it without getting bored. I was considering giving this game a thumbs down since there is no intermediate option, but Lego Star Wars just has such a special place in my heart that I just can't do it in good conscience.

author: Lialexen
review: A very well done modern “remake” (more like an entirely new game) of the complete Saga (this game has the sequels too). It’s so different compared to it you could even consider it an entirely new game which it technically is, optional voice acting or mumbling if you prefer, Mass Effect style traveling to planets and open spaces to just explore not just linear story missions like in TCS, a lot longer and more in depth, modernized gameplay and graphics and an entirely redone camera view that’s similar to a 3rd Person Shooter not a set position, very funny, even more so than TCS. There’s a few random people who I’ve seen complain in there reviews about it being short, which is not the case it’s way longer than TCS and has a lot more secrets and completionist goals that’ll at least quadruple your time in game if done. Now there’s a few issues one being optimization.. this is only really an issue in the droid factory in Attack of The Clones, or when there’s a lot of VFX like studs on the screen but still it occurs quite often. Another being the shooting at times is hard to aim and hard to keep track of your targets, with stronger aim assist and smoother camera movement this could be easily fixed lastly is an issue where the refresh rate resets back to the original 60 when I tab out of the game and back it, it wont keep 144HZ unless I manually change it back again. It’s well worth its price, especially since it’s marketed 10$ under your average Triple A game and unlike those games like COD and Madden this has the content to back up its price tag.

author: Nottrson
review: The short version of my comment is that while it is mostly fun, I would not recommend buying it as it is (especially given the cost). Basically, it's a bit of a letdown after all the hype I'd heard from it, and several parts are borderline insulting in my opinion. If you want to know more, read below.It's an alright game, I enjoy playing it. The overhauled game play has a bit of a learning curve, but overall I enjoy it. What I  like about this game is how they seem to have made light of everything, with jokes and silly things in practically every scene. It's off putting, especially when they do things like make Cordé (one of Padmé's handmaidens who dies at the start of episode 2) into a joke. Like, come on! That was a really emotional and potent scene in the films, and the producers just turned it into a joke. This is hardly the only example of this either, like with Qui-Gon's death, Han being frozen in carbonite, the list goes on.I understand that this game is more geared towards younger individuals, and I get that you need to be careful in what you include in the game because of this, but I don't think that making jokes about people dying is the way to go, especially with events such as the war in Ukraine going on. In addition, there are a lot of lines from the movie that don't actually show up in the game, which generally is a minor irritation at most, since I know that including all of them would bog the game down in constant dialogue, but again, there are some lines that weren't included that really should be because of their emotional relevance.Also, and this is really a relatively minor concern, I miss a bunch of the missions from the older LEGO Star Wars games. I get that the new framework makes it impossible to transfer them over exactly or anything, but these new missions are so short and, in a number of cases, largely unsatisfying, such as the Hoth missions. While before you had to work your way through several areas, blowing up ATAT's and ATST's as you went, now you just need to spend 5 minutes at most firing and moving around a relatively small battlefield, an issue that is also seen in the Death Star trench run. Meanwhile, other missions, such as the old escape from the rebel base on Hoth mission from previous games, seem to be omitted almost entirely.On top of all this, it feels that this game isn't living up to its full potential with the multiple paths and whatnot. While I do love the fact that iconic scenes from the films can now be explored extensively (seriously cool), I would prefer a more varied approach, as it feels like 80% of the game is just running around from point A to point B. Also, I find the battles that I do participate in to be unsatisfying. I've played through most of the first 6 episodes, and I can count the number of times I 'died' in battle on 1 hand, despite rarely using cover or any kind of advanced strategy.I know that's a lot, so I'll summarise my views in order of importance (as I see it at least). Ultimately, I want at least the option to have scenes that are truer to the movies, closer to how they did the LEGO Lord of the Rings or the original LEGO Star Wars games. I'd like the game to have a variable difficulty (or even just a bit more difficult in general). It would be nice to have the actual missions expanded, so that they don't consist of you running (or flying) around 1 small area (like Hoth and the Death Star), and so you can actually participate in certain scenes that you can't now (such as the attack on the second Death Star, the blowing up of the shield generator on Endor, and an expansion to escaping from Hoth).

author: Connnnair
review: I had more fun playing Lego Star Wars The Force Awakens, And I soft-locked on 8 separate occasions while playing that bug filled ♥♥♥♥ pile of a game. This game is an escort mission simulator, and you cant disable subtitles in mumble mode, the best solution imo is to leave the dubbing language in something you cant understand like Japanese or something if you want the disable subtitles checkbox to actually have an impact in mumble mode. This game got delayed by 2 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ years for some of the worst game play I've ever experienced. This will be the last Lego game I will buy. If you want the definitive experience of playing this I recommend you to play My Cat-girl Maid Thinks She Owns The Place for the little 5 minute adventures you go on where you walk with one character to the next story location so you can watch the game play you wanted to have be replaced by a cut-scene of what would be the only enjoyable part of the game to play. You literally just get to play the filler and have the game's (unskippable) cut-scenes take over for the minor boss fights in each episode.

author: Alfie
review: This game is lacking one of the best features in any Lego game, the game yes may have a large character roster. nice graphics and pretty fun side quests, but really no character creator. i'm not even gonna lie the lack of custom characters like made this game go from like a 9.5 to a 6.the custom characters added hours of fun to even the blandest Lego games, i mean it was only just starting to get good to the point that even a game as bland as LMS2 had hours of content, having the ability to use parts from the characters you unlock go into the character creator made it feel like there was a actual reason to go get the like the 12 reskins of spiderman.I'm also just going to mention that the current in game character roster is kinda not great theres like only 10 Sith available, i just kind of wished that we had more varied options.I do take into consideration the development hell this game went through with the switch of engines and how a character creator may just not be in the scope of the project but its just kind of sad. TLDR: the game is really really good but the lack a character creator leaves a sour taste in my mouth, they have posted to twitter a statement about them having no plans for content updates which kinda leaves the possibility of it being an update dead in the water.

author: Daniel Fortesque
review: If you are a fan of the Complete Saga than you will mostly likely enjoy this game too. While it is very different in how it plays and handles story levels, it is still a fun experience and expands the universe a lot with a bunch of the unique and large explore-able planets. The only real problems I had was how short a lot of the story missions were and how a lot of the side quests were very similar and boring to do. Oh and there are quite a number of annoying and game breaking bugs to watch out for, luckily I somehow didn't run into any of the game breaking ones, but the bugs I did run into can be a real pain. Aside from those it's a fun game with a lot of memes thrown in as well to keep it fresh and entertaining.DLCs kind of suck though.

author: CozmicNonsense
review: Maybe the most broken PC launch I've played. 90% of the time, wont recognize my controller or even the keyboard on startup. Sometimes everything will stop functioning except the pause button. (I beat the trench run by waiting for my ship to crash, turns out it victory is automatic) Always changes my resolution settings when starting or tab out so I have to change them EVERY TIME I start it up. Freezes when loading, crashes every few levels. Framerate can go from 144fps to 30 for seemingly no reason at all and stays that way for a while (vsync is off). Maybe not everyone's experience, but I literally cannot play the game because it wont recognize my controller or keyboard nearly every time I launch this. I have to just keep restarting until it eventually works for no reason. Actually literally unplayable. Wouldn't even run on my girlfriends computer, so she had to refund it. Even if she could we wouldn't be able to play normal co-op because this studio exists in a time vacuum and hasn't discovered we live in the 21st century and have had online gaming for 2 decades now. Split screen is archaic and gives me a migraineThis game also requires some extra options for HUD customization and accessibility such as:Turning off health bars, they're so gigantic they OFTEN cover the enemies. They also aren't really needed for a game like this.Turning off vision cones and attack markers. Anyone over the age of 3 doesn't need them and they are extremely ugly.Might be personal preference but one of the first things that genuinely bothered me from the start, turning off Stormtrooper helmets flying off when hit. Really constantly immersion breaking. Also, having rooms be absolutely filled with Stormtrooper armor is the worst. Definitely need to limit that in some way. Maybe only have it drop the 3 parts you need then cut it off there.

author: Cloud Xeno
review: This Game lacks depth~ most of the game is the Open World which has no real substance, they could have done so much especially with NPCs they could have had roles (like previous games had), or any value to them at all, they're just clutter to the streets and halls. The Game-play is decent, but they took out aspects which MADE Lego Star Wars~ like Force abilities. The uniqueness of characters made playing them special and then they also took out the creation part as well, which makes no sense. *They'll probably add it as DLC* It's Fun if you are immune to mind numbing or speed through every mission and just do Story because most aspects of the game aren't necessary. Kyber Bricks and Data Cards are just for completionists, but hold no real value regarding the core of the game. This game was most definitely over hyped and mostly made for children hence the dull and conscienceless nature of it. It removed some of the more "violent" aspects that made the game immersive and dare I say Fun, and replaced them with a useless skill tree that has no real affect on gameplay in the slightest.

review: When I was a kid, I played a downgraded version of this game.Now I'm an adult and I stare into the monitor for too long as my eyes gloss over and slowly but surely point into separate directions; I then steadily nod off to sleep on the couch, head pointing straight up at the ceiling. author: Chandler
review: I finished the story out of spite more than anything. All the constituent parts are there, it looks great and has the accessibility of all the Lego games.However, I've never played a game that takes away player agency so often and so jarringly. Every other minute you're forced to slow down or stop. You can only jump where allowed, fight when allowed (it literally stops you in boss fights until ready). The camera is forced away at random intervals and the gameplay is just so interrupted it drove me mad.In freeplay this is fun, no doubt. Stay there it's great. The story not so much.

author: Chalmun
review: Game is not optimized at all and lacks graphical options to attempt to get stable performance on the Steam Deck. I bought this primarily to play on the Deck and FPS drops into the 20s are frequent - it is unplayable on the Deck and Valve giving it a verified status is a joke. Any combination of scaling w/ FSR, reducing FPS caps to 45 or 30, and the limited graphics settings all at low...you will STILL get drops into the 20s! Avoid if you thought this would be a great game on the Deck.

author: Lombardown
review: Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth Plagueis The Wise? I thought not. It’s not a story the Jedi would tell you. It’s a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise he could use the Force to influence the midichlorians to create life… He had such a knowledge of the dark side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful… the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself...

author: BiggieCheese
review: Game is littered with bugs. I love lego starwars and will try to continue playing, but the amount of bugs that exist is insane. I didn't run into many bugs in first 6 episodes, there were some, but few and not ass bad. Episodes 7-9 are insane. the second level or first (First Order of Business) has one  major soft lock if you go out of the hanger bay and no enemies spawn. I wanted to try alternative routes but the vents are blocked and impassible by a red barrier and the officer with keycard never spawns. After giving up on those exits I went back and the grapple point to get into the hanger is back and wont allow me to grapple. I have to completely reset the level and do it. Rey in the open world portion has a bug where if you unequip an item then attack normally your character is stuck going one way and you have to kill the character to reset them. If I find these bugs are fixed or I find more I will update or take down.

author: Baggie
review: Initial thoughts:Two hours into the game, hadn't actually interacted with Lego to build anything. Game seems to has next to nothing to do with Lego, it seems more of a star wars vaguely Lego themed action game.EDIT: Five hours in, have built 2 things. General feeling still stands.Game is entirely over the shoulder third person, not the top down view the original Lego Star Wars games used to have. Makes it especially difficult to split-screen which is strictly down the middle of the screen, which limits your view pretty significantly.Day one DLC gets appears before the intro cinematic finishes, which is a bit of a slap in the face.Padme hits on Anakin like as soon as she sees him, like instantly. It's hilarious so maybe consider that a pro. Humour is generally alright, though it really depends on taste.It's fine, but nothing hugely special overall. Depends on what you're looking for from this game really, if you're looking for something similar to the original games this isn't it.

author: urulókë
review: I really want to like this game, I just sadly don't. I think mostly this has to do with me wanting to have the glory days of the old Star Wars games, but it's just not the same.- The Co-Op is just split screen, making it suck for couch gaming, as the screen just gets too small.- The lego jokes are bad as always, but there is not a split second in a cutscene where they are not doing one.- The maps are way too open worldish. To the point where they needed to add a big annoying box telling you were to go. The original games didn't need this, as it was just straight forward.- Getting true jedi is tedious and you have no progress bar while playing, so just farm and hope you farmed enough.I can go on, played only 2 hours and more than 1 hour of it, we were forcing ourself to play.It's prob. good if you didn't try to relieve the old lego star wars days.

author: Taco
review: I love this game very much. The combat's engaging, the comedy is funny, and it brings me back to my childhood and helped respark my love for Star Wars. There is SO much to do!! If in the future they decided to add an expansion that would add characters and missions from the Clone Wars and Rebels tv shows, I wouldn't mind paying for that; THAT'S how good this game is. The only gripes I have are the several times my game's crashed because of something simple like switching to Jango Fett and in free play mode for boss levels where it forces you to switch to the story characters (like if you wanna fight Anakin as General Grievous, there are points in the fight where it forces you to become Obi Wan), but even considering those annoying flaws, it's an easy 9.5/10! Definitely worth getting if you're a Lego Game fan or a Star Wars fan.

author: CheesyJay
review: Fantastic Game, The best Lego Game of all time.A great way to explore Star Wars Stories and it's even friendly for people who have never watched Star Wars. Fast Paced Gameplay and tons of content to do, I can't wait to 100% this.The only flaws so far in this game is that the Change Character options in Free Play is confusing to figure out at first and is just too complex. For some reason in Attack of the Clones Episode I kept getting frame drops and laggy gameplay in two missions that really turned me off from playing but it only happened for 2 mins in each of those levels and it never returned. And the last flaw is that there is alot of walking to missions, it;ll be like Go here to talk to this person then you have to travel across the galaxy just to talk to a person with 2 lines of dialogue then go to another person and then the mission started. This mostly happens in the Pre-sequels and in The Last Jedi Episode but it was only for abit and didn't really affect most of the story since it was fast to load.Highly recommend at full price since its like 70 - 60 bucks, every penny is worth it.

review: NOT WORTH IT THIS SUCKS This game seemed fun for the first 10 minutes, once you start playing you realize there was no love put into it, the co-op mode sucks only one player has something to do at a time, the jokes are all terrible, the gameplay is confusing and cluttered, none of the quicktime events matter, the game is far too easy, mini-map system sucks why are there so many options but no difficulty, and the story doesn't even track with the movies. author: joestyler
review: why does everyone seem to like this game? so many blinded fans who dont wanna see how boring it is..for kids its probably fun, but still dont buy this game for your children cuz they'll become stupid.(i played longer than 0.4h but offline so dont get confused)what i liked:- everything looks very polished. the menues, the ui, so many options and controller support, languages, coop, no bugs or performance issues for me- the graphics finally look like real lego almost, not so much like cgi. more of the environment is made out of lego bricks, also big spaceships which shows already the effort put into this, although this makes the proportions sometimes wrong (for example the tantive iv hallways are too big) because otherwise the level of detail wouldve been too small. also you have to get used to understanding which parts of the world are interactable and which not - as they stood out much more in TCSeverything else sucks oh boy where even start..- the voice acting is super bad. not only that the voices are unfamiliar but also the acting is unconvincing and often enough embarrassing- the whole star wars feeling got completely lost. the worlds look totally different, for example lukes homestead: if you remember the look of it in the original with the whole atmosphere that goes along with it.. the wide desert, the sunset, the emptiness.. its nothing like that here. here luke lives in a stupid village with many cliffs and mountains and hundreds of people walking around... its hard to put it into words but you will know what i mean when you see it. also mos eisley just doesnt feel like mos eisley at all.. i remember the old mos eisley in TCS. back then it also had a different placement of buildings and all but it WAS mos eisley. now all the buildings and textures and even color correction make it seem very strange. also the characters act very weird and funny but not in the way they intended it. for example obi wan doesnt seem important when he appears (as in the movie), he doesnt seem wise and humbly powerful.. he seems like a boring, distant, unlikable space terrorist- the new gameplay is just very boring and repetetive "riddles", following a 3d marker that tells you ALWAYS where to go and what to do, and shooting/lightsaber slaying stupid and easy AI which is barely ever different from each other. killing enemies takes quite long with both blasters and lightsabers so its just time consuming and annoying but never actually difficult- the "open world" is just small areas between the levels, that are incredibly full with stuff and characters yet feel completely empty and lifeless as these characters all behave in the same, boring way. vehicles are useless because you never NEED them to travel around and also the area is way too small and full with things as that you could actually roam around- the look often doesnt feel star wars-y. i think the colors and textures are wrong- the ui is too stuffed - there is too much going on, quests, 3d marker, the coin counter (its split now into three parts for whatever reason), minimap (why even??) etc. also the ui has very un-star-wars-y colors and shapes, for example the dialogue text is displayed on a purple rectangle with faded edges that (if you saw it) you would agree doesnt fit into the star wars color palette or anything. and its just one example for the many things that annoy me about the ui- there is too much stuff that has no meaning. in TCS u had the coins, the minikits and the red bricks which all had a purpose and made sense. now you have so many things to unlock.. areas, vehicles, characters, abilities in general/for jedis/droids etc., find 5 minikits per level, do short boring side missions in the open world- no steam preload for preorders- unskippable cutscenes all the time, that are way too long and still manage to rush the story and certainly will make people confused who didnt see the movies- no character creator- so many characters that you can play, yet nothing unique about them. r2d2 cant fly anymore, c3po is as fast as leia, droids can sprint, jump and fight stormtroopers now (even 3po). the gonk droid can be ridden now and he is much faster than he should be (in TCS he was just funny af cuz he was absolutely useless), the animations of 3po dont look like anyting 3po could physically even acomplish (and that doesnt make it feel funny or like its the "lego experience" but more like "this has nothing to do with star wars" and that the character you're playing might be anyone - not c3po)- no hub world where you could go to the bar and buy characters or start a level by entering that mysterious door. now this is all inside a menu..i didnt want to rant about this game, i thought it was gonna be amazing but its disappointing and you shouldnt buy it. it doesnt feel like star wars, the gameplay is repetetitive, boring and too easy and the story feels rushed and stupid.
