author: VolCunt The Explorer™
review: As someone who has 100% completed the game, and got all achievements... Here's what i have to say.TL:DR - Buy it on sale, but it's buggier than Cyberpunk.Story - When i was young i was obsessed with Lego star wars games, not only those, but any Lego game. But i have to say, level wise... I'm very disappointed.You may say "They have to keep levels short because of how many episodes there are!".And i'd somewhat agree, BUT Lego Star Wars 2 had 6 fully lengthened episodes. Filled with 10 minikits and a hard to get true hero. There are hub worlds, but these worlds are more detailed than the actual story itself. I found myself doing anything BUT the story because there was so much to do.So overall for story, it's lacking movie details and key battles, Disappointing.Graphics - Absolutely smooth and lifelike, they've really done a good job with them. No complaints about them.Gameplay - The lightsaber battles are the selling point imo.That being said, there is really no skill involved other than spamming Left Click (I understand this is a kids game... and is marketed towards the lower ages, however the same was said for OOT and Super Mario)I have to brush over the other things too - If, like me, you went for 100%... Then you have to SLOWLY do everything Kyber Brick related.What i mean by this, is you have to watch the same animation 950+ times.There have been a few times i have glitched it so it skips, but this happened maybe 50 times.SIDE NOTE - The character voices are pretty annoying when you have to switch constantly. They say the same things EVERY time you switch, even mumble mode doesn't really solve this issue.The quests are Meh at best. The best way i can describe them is like a Halo campaign. What this means is that it's basically, "Go here, do this, Go here, Blow up this" etc etc.Overall, again disappointed.Bugs - As a guy who has beated Cyberpunk 2077, 4 times. This game really does take the cake as one of the buggiest games, it literally has nothing on Cyberpunk.Just a little list:Crashes everywhere.Framerate issues on 2 specific missions.Bugged Quests.Settings resetting mid game.A weird 4:3 resolution bug which happens if you have more than 1 monitor.Overall - A decent "open world" Lego Game.But due to the bugs, lack of story and lack of mission variety..6.5/10.Extra - I spent more time finding where to go for a campaign mission, than being IN the mission itself.You could speedrun an episode in 10 mins... And there's 9 episodes...

author: Mercader Xaan
review: I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 16. My son recently started Dinkum and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: ZplaysGames
review: First of all, the game is completely broken. Not only did it regularly soft lock and crash, but it also crashed my entire computer three times. One of those crashes was 70 hours in, and it corrupted my save file, so I lost 70 hours of progress. That is completely unacceptable in any game, and shows a clear lack of care went into the stability of the game. Luckily, I was able to find Reddit threads with a ton of people who had the same issues as me, and based on what they said, I was able to spend 3 hours and hack together a Frankenstein's monster of my corrupted save and a new save, to more or less get my progress back. On top of that, the camera is broken and constantly gets stuck on terrain, the controls regularly don't do what they say they'll do, and every single time you shoot a weapon, it zooms in the camera for no reason, then zooms the camera back out. Playing this game is nothing short of a miserable chore. I suffered through the entire game, because I couldn't believe that the game would stay as bad as it started, but it started out horrible and stayed that way.If you liked the original Lego games, then this game will feel like an absolute middle finger. Everything fun and creative from the originals has been stripped away and replaced with generic third person shooter mechanics and an irritating upgrade tree. Every action from switching characters, to using the force, to starting a level, all take a ludicrous number of button presses to perform, where they would take one button press in the originals. Every character, even among the 9 classes, feels exactly the same. The game is bogged down with endless unskippable cut scenes, random lingering camera pans, and nonstop walking in a straight line through the hub worlds. Everything has been meticulously designed to be as slow, tedious, and frustrating as possible.Playing through some of the episodes in story mode is literally 80% doing nothing. I recorded my play through of the game, all 83 hours, looked through the recordings, and measured the length of everything. About 20% of the episode was playing levels, and the rest was sitting through cut scenes and walking in a straight line in the open world. Even that 20% of playing the levels is still bogged down with cut scenes, unskippable animations, and endless boring quick time events where you spam a button. Calling this a game is damn near false advertising. I play video games to interact with the game and do things, not to hold down a button and watch cut scenes.The only positive I can say about this game is that the open world occasionally had moments where it felt like a Lego game, but to get to those moments, you have to slog through so much insufferable filler, that it's not even remotely worth it.It took me 83 hours to 100% this game, and if it weren't for all the terrible cut scenes, unskippable animations, and quick time events, this would've been a 30 hour game, maybe even less. This game is an insult.

author: Smelim S. Medem
review: I really really really tried to enjoy this game. And I did, but:- The campaign is packed way too tightly, many interesting missions and locations are skipped - like the Battle over Coruscant from Ep 3.- The cutscenes are way too fast and try to fit in way too many jokes, so I can hardly catch them all.- Barely two hours for one episode.- Many bugs and blackscreens.- Some hubs are pointless and barebones - like Gungan city and Lake Paonga are there just for the sake being there.- Slave I is not called Slave I but "Boba Fett's ship" for the sake of safespace.- Forced diversity - black female Stormtroopers and so on.- Minifigs not longer feel unique. They do have superb animations, but they ALL have the same mechanics. Nearly all characters can do a forward-jumping attack - even droids! Even C3PO can jump, sprint and bash.- TPS combat does not suit LEGO games at all. Keep that for Battlefront games.- The combat is just EASY. No challenge whatsoever. Yeah it's a Lego game, but comeon, you know that non-kids play this game too.Now some pros:+ Graphics is superb, so are some animations.+ Space combat is decent, but still easy.+ Comedy is pretty good too+ Voice actors are surprisingly good!TL:DR Less is more!!!!

author: BlushedHalo
review: Was hoping the game was only going to be a graphics update to the old games, then adding the new saga on top. Sadly playing not even playing through 2hrs of this game they've changed the old jokes the game had and won't even kill Jango by chopping his head off, like they previously did. This game has gone even more PG than it used to be. Majority of the time you can stand still and no enemies will attack you and you automatically block shots coming your way. This may be a kids game, but so were the originals and they weren't hard to play when we were kids, now the game is stupidly easy. They've also added a lot of unnecessary mechanics to the game that don't really change a lot. They're just there because they wanted to update the game somehow. In an effort to make the game size smaller (I think??) they've also made the levels really short for some reason?But don't get me wrong this game looks amazing and if you want to buy it for that instead of the originals that are also on Steam understandable. You, do you. But this game had a lot of potential, and it feels like they took all the best bits out of the game, in an effort to make the game the most PG friendly thing you've ever seen.

review: [Cons]Not worth the price tag.Rushed, short levels.Jar Jar is more annoying than in the movie.Boring unskippable cutscenes.Holds your hand more than any lego game.Not meant for adults who just want a chill nostalgia trip(like i did).Boss Fights are uninspired.Fights weren't plentiful.No longer family friendly, it's now just for kidsCan spam force push and end all fights in 2 seconds.[Notes/Neutral Thoughts]Voice lines are mostly ripped from the movies, except for a few key characters(voiced by Tom Kane).Stopped after the Darth Maul fight and got frustrated with how boring my entire playthrough was.Lightsabers felt fluid, but ended quickly and weren't plentiful.This is all coming from a Star Wars fanboy who grew up with it. It's almost as uninspired as the sequel movies.[Pros]Graphics are really good.

author: BOT Waldo
review: I am not a star wars fan. Of course I have watched all the movies and series but I am not a hard core fan of the series. I just wanted to say that before I continue.I bought the game cause I had seen pretty much everyone praising it for being "the best lego game" or "the best game of the year" or something like that. When I started playing it I was kinda hyped even. I had played the complete saga when I was little so I kinda had a nostalgic connection to all the lego games in general. So I booted up the game and started playing.First thing I realised was how short the levels were. I just played the game casually and finished Phantom Menace in only 1 hour. I get that you have to search for all the collectables and stuff like that but I did find some and I even did a some side mission that were just that I had to do some puzzle and then get something to some guy. It basicly goes like this. You go somewhere. Than you get a 10 second cutscene (The older lego games had even 5 minute long cutscenes). Then you run to some other place and fight some guys (that are childishly easy) and then repeat. The game should make a difficulty setting for non 3 year olds. It gets really boring. And even the cutscenes are ruined by some weird humor that only a 4 year old would find funny. I get that lego games are made for children but come on. They have to know that most of the people who are going to buy this game are like in high school and get this game because of nostalgia for the other lego games. Then after you have run for like 20 minutes you get thrown into an "open world" area. These areas are just empty places that have some npcs that give you side missions. And these places are HUGE. And quess what you'll be doing in these areas? Run. You have to run in these beautiful places and there is like nothing to do (apart from searching for the collectables for an hour that mostly give you cosmetic stuff).So yes. I wouldn't recommend this game. Even to some one who is a "star wars fan". And yes I get it. Some people who really like star wars just want the game because they can see darth vader looking cool. If you want to spend 50 dollars. Like 50 dollars for a lego game! I'm done. I even played The new hope to see if the prequels were just bad but same thing.Hope this review helps some of you to think again before buying the game.

author: mouse enjoyer
review: Fun game, PC port is garbage. Like I have an I9, 3090 RTX, 32 GB of ram and it still lags. Bad optimization and Episode 3 keeps freezing.

author: snyderj73
review: boring campaign missions with more cut scenes and escorts than gameplay. Cant change ships in free play missions. have encountered several level breaking bug forcing entire level resets. bugs with character selections not working/resetting. overall poor quality game made worse when compared to the complete saga.

author: s1k
review: It's (very sadly) not a remaster of the Complete Saga with the Sequels added. If you're searching for that old birds eye view gameplay, you won't find it here. Its a third person shooter with lego star wars skins, I don't know what else to call it. If you're looking to boot it up for nostalgias sake, plaly the original with shaders, if you're looking for a new and refined lego star wars experience, you're gonna have fun with it. I know this review is bad, because for me subjectively the game is. Even the way you play together (Co-Op) has changed (Splitscreen). It's just not what I wanted and expected.

author: Danny
review: This is probably the best Lego game they ever created, and a superb Star Wars game. Heck, I prefer this over the recent battlefront games, and I probably like this almost as much as Jedi: Fallen Order, both of which is in my library.However, it does NOT have character customization, which is my personal, primary reason for playing Lego games at all. Got it refunded after 3hrs and 45min. Why that exact time? It is because that is when I actually found out that there was no customization, by googling how to customize our character in the Skywalker Saga game.I didn't even expect to be able to customize with all the characters. That would be crazy, and probably too much, considering how much the devs have already worked on the game. Wouldn't complain if they do it in the future. If they do add it, or even add it as a DLC, im willing to buy the game again WITH that DLC. But considering how hard they worked on the game, maybe they could select a limited number of aspects and parts that can be used for customization. I hope they do something like that. But until then, I will not touch this game.Don't get me wrong though, it is still an amazing game. The puzzles, humor, and open-world exploration is better than ever. Visuals too (might need a semi-strong pc). The only reason I'm downvoting this is because I'm just really disappointed that you cannot custom-create a character at all. They could have included a smaller version rather than using the whole roster, but they did not even do that. If you are like me, and absolutely must have character customization, I recommend that you delay opening up your wallets.
